No standard or amendment to a standard shall come into effect less than 30 days after it is made.

A standard or an amendment to a standard may be made and brought into effect by the Minister without regard to subsections (2) and (3) where the standard or amendment is urgently required to ensure aviation safety or the safety of the public.

Heading.TitleText: Inspection of Aircraft, Requests for Production of Documents and Prohibitions

Subsection.Text: The owner or operator of an aircraft shall, on reasonable notice given by the Minister, make the aircraft available for inspection in accordance with the notice.
Every person who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is the holder of a Canadian aviation document,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is the owner, operator or pilot-in-command of an aircraft in respect of which a Canadian aviation document, technical record or other document is kept, or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has in possession a Canadian aviation document, technical record or other document relating to an aircraft or a commercial air service

ContinuedSectionSubsection.Text: shall produce the Canadian aviation document, technical record or other document for inspection in accordance with the terms of a demand made by a peace officer, an immigration officer or the Minister.

Subsection.Text: No person shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: lend a Canadian aviation document to any person who is not entitled to it by these Regulations, or allow any such person to use a Canadian aviation document; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: mutilate, alter or render illegible a Canadian aviation document.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of this section, other document includes all writings, papers and other records made, held or maintained by the owner, operator or pilot-in-command of an aircraft for the purpose of recording any action, activity, performance or use of the aircraft or any activity of the owner, operator or crew members in respect of that aircraft, whether or not the documents are required by law to be made, held or maintained.

Section.Text: Where a Canadian aviation document has been suspended or cancelled, the person to whom it was issued shall return it to the Minister immediately after the effective date of the suspension or cancellation.
Recording systems, including computer records and microfiche, that do not comprise entries on paper may be used to comply with the record-keeping requirements of these Regulations if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: measures are taken to ensure that the records contained in the recording systems are protected, by electronic or other means, against inadvertent loss or destruction and against tampering; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the records contained in the recording systems can be printed on paper and provided to the Minister on reasonable notice given by the Minister.

Heading.TitleText: Notices of Refusal to Issue, Amend or Renew and Notices of Suspension or Cancellation

Subsection.Text: A notice issued by the Minister pursuant to subsections 6.9(1) and (2) of the Act shall include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the particulars of the alleged contravention;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: where the Minister has decided to suspend the Canadian aviation document, a statement of the duration of the suspension; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a statement that a request for review by the Tribunal does not operate as a stay of the suspension or cancellation but that an application may be made in writing to the Tribunal, pursuant to subsection 6.9(4) of the Act, to stay the suspension or cancellation until the review of the decision of the Minister has been concluded.

Subsection.Text: A notice issued by the Minister pursuant to subsections 7(1) and (2) of the Act shall include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the effective date of the suspension;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a statement of the conditions under which the suspension is terminated; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a statement that a request for review by the Tribunal does not operate as a stay of the suspension.

Subsection.Text: A notice issued by the Minister pursuant to subsections 7.1(1) and (2) of the Act shall include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: where the Minister has decided to suspend or cancel a Canadian aviation document, a statement of the effective date of the suspension or cancellation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: where the Minister has decided to suspend the Canadian aviation document, a statement of the duration of the suspension or the conditions under which the suspension is terminated; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a statement that a request for review by the Tribunal does not operate as a stay of the suspension, cancellation or refusal to renew.

Subsection.Text: A notice issued by the Minister under subsection 6.71(2) of the Act informing an applicant or an owner or operator of an aircraft, aerodrome, airport or other facility of the Minister's decision made under subsection 6.71(1) of the Act to refuse to issue or amend a Canadian aviation document in respect of the aircraft, aerodrome, airport or other facility shall be in the form set out in Schedule I to this Subpart.

Heading.TitleText: Administrative Grounds for Suspension, Cancellation or Refusal to Renew

Section.Text: In addition to the grounds referred to in sections 6.9 to 7.1 of the Act, the Minister may suspend, cancel or refuse to renew a Canadian aviation document where

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the Canadian aviation document has been voluntarily surrendered to the Minister by its holder;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Canadian aviation document has been mutilated, altered, or rendered illegible;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the aircraft in respect of which the Canadian aviation document was issued has been destroyed or withdrawn from use; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the commercial air service, other service or undertaking in respect of which the Canadian aviation document was issued has been discontinued.

Subsection.Text: The provisions set out in column I of Schedule II to this Subpart are hereby designated as provisions the contravention of which may be dealt with under, and in accordance with the procedure set out in, sections 7.7 to 8.2 of the Act.
The amounts set out in column II of Schedule II to this Subpart are the maximum amounts payable in respect of a contravention of the designated provisions set out in column I.
A notice issued to a person by the Minister under subsection 7.7(1) of the Act shall specify

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the particulars of the alleged contravention;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that the person on or to whom the notice is served or sent has the option of paying the amount specified in the notice or filing a request for a review with the Tribunal of the alleged contravention or the amount of the penalty;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: that payment of the amount specified in the notice will be accepted by the Minister in satisfaction of the amount of the penalty for the alleged contravention and that no further proceedings under Part I of the Act will be taken against the person on or to whom the notice in respect of that contravention is served or sent;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: that, if the person on or to whom the notice is served or sent files a request for a review with the Tribunal, that person will be provided with an opportunity consistent with procedural fairness and natural justice to present evidence before the Tribunal and make representations in relation to the alleged contravention; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: that, if the person on or to whom the notice is served or sent fails to pay the amount specified in the notice and fails to file a request for a review with the Tribunal within the prescribed period, that person will be deemed to have committed the contravention set out in the notice.

Heading.TitleText: Division V — Preservation and Return of Evidence or Aircraft

Section.Text: Where the Minister seizes anything pursuant to paragraph 8.7(1)(c) of the Act, the Minister shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: mark it in a clearly identifiable manner;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: take reasonable care to preserve it until it is required to be produced as evidence; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: return it to the person from whom it was seized within 90 days after the seizure, where

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: there is no dispute as to who is lawfully entitled to possession of the thing seized,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the return is not likely to affect aviation safety, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the continued detention of the thing seized is not required for the purposes of an investigation, hearing or other similar proceeding.

Section.Text: Where the Minister detains an aircraft pursuant to paragraph 8.7(1)(d) of the Act, the Minister shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: take reasonable care to preserve it; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: return it to the person who had custody of it when it was detained or to the person who is lawfully entitled to possession of it, where the Minister has reasonable grounds to believe that the aircraft

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: will not be operated, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: is airworthy or will be rendered airworthy prior to operation and will not be operated in an unsafe manner.

Section.Text: Nothing in these Regulations shall be construed as requiring the Minister to make repairs or modifications to anything seized or detained pursuant to paragraph 8.7(1)(c) or (d) of the Act.
For the purposes of paragraphs 6.71(1)(c) and 7.1(1)(c) of the Act, principal means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of an air operator,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: any person who is employed or contracted by the air operator on a full- or part-time basis as the operations manager, the chief pilot or the person responsible for the maintenance control system, or any person who occupies an equivalent position,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: any person who exercises control over the air operator as an owner, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the accountable executive appointed by the air operator under section 106.02;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a private operator,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: any person who is employed or contracted by the private operator on a full- or part-time basis as the operations manager, maintenance manager or chief pilot, or any person who occupies an equivalent position, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: any person who exercises control over the private operator as an owner;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of an approved maintenance organization,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: any person who is employed or contracted by the approved maintenance organization on a full- or part-time basis as the person responsible for maintenance,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: any person who exercises control over the approved maintenance organization as an owner; and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the accountable executive appointed by the approved maintenance organization under section 106.02;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of an approved training organization,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: any person who is responsible for the quality control system, or any person who occupies an equivalent position, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: any person who exercises control over the approved training organization as an owner;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a flight training unit,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the chief flight instructor,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: any person who is employed or contracted by the flight training unit on a full- or part-time basis as the person responsible for the maintenance control system,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: any person who exercises control over the flight training unit as an owner, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the accountable executive appointed by the flight training unit under section 106.02;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a manufacturer of aeronautical products,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: any person who is responsible for the quality control system, or any person who occupies an equivalent position, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: any person who exercises control over the manufacturer as an owner;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a distributor of aeronautical products,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: any person who is responsible for the product control system, or any person who occupies an equivalent position, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: any person who exercises control over the distributor as an owner;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of an airport,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: any person who is employed or contracted by its operator on a full- or part-time basis as the airport manager, or any person who occupies an equivalent position,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: any person who exercises control over the airport as an owner, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the accountable executive appointed by its operator under paragraph 106.02(1)(a); and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a provider of air traffic services,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: any person who is employed or contracted by the provider of air traffic services on a full- or part-time basis as the operations manager, or any person who occupies an equivalent position,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: any person who exercises control over the provider of air traffic services as an owner, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the accountable executive appointed by the provider of air traffic services under paragraph 106.02(1)(a).

ImageGroup.AlternateText: Top of form Notice of refusal to issue or amend a Canadian aviation document.

Heading.TitleText: Notice of Refusal to Issue or Amend a Canadian Aviation Document

Provision.Text: Pursuant to section 6.71 of the Aeronautics Act, the Minister of Transport has decided to refuse to issue or amend the Canadian aviation document identified below.
The grounds for the Minister’s decision are set out in Appendix A.

If you wish a review of the Minister’s decision by the Transportation Appeal Tribunal of Canada, you must file a request in writing with the Tribunal on or before the date that is indicated above. Requests for review may be filed with the Transportation Appeal Tribunal of Canada, 333 Laurier Avenue West, Room 1201, Ottawa, Ontario K1A 0N5 (tel.: (613) 990-6906).

On receipt of your request, the Tribunal will set a time and place for a hearing into the Minister’s grounds for the decision to refuse to issue or amend the above-noted Canadian aviation document. You will be afforded a full opportunity consistent with procedural fairness and natural justice to present evidence and make representations in relation to the Minister’s grounds before the Tribunal makes its determination. The Tribunal has prepared a booklet entitled Guide for Applicants, which you may obtain from the Tribunal.
The particulars set out in this notice are also available in the other official language from the Transport Canada Regional Office indicated above.
Incompetence (par. 6.71(1)(a))
Qualifications or conditions necessary for issuance or amendment not met or fulfilled (par. 6.71(1)(b))
Public interest reasons for refusal (par. 6.71(1)(c))
Details of Minister’s grounds for the decision indicated above:

Section.Text: Subject to section 104.03, the charge imposed in respect of the issuance, renewal, amendment or endorsement or, in the case of a medical certificate, the processing, on or after January 1, 1998 of a document referred to in column I of an item of Schedules I to VII to this Subpart is the charge set out in column II of the item.

As provided by paragraph 4.4(2)(b) of the Act, if a document referred to in column I of an item of Schedules I to VII to this Subpart is not issued, renewed, amended or endorsed but action preparatory thereto has been carried out, the charge calculated in accordance with section 104.01, 104.03 or 104.04 is payable.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), the charge imposed in respect of the issuance, renewal, amendment or endorsement on or after January 1, 1998 of a document referred to in column I of items 1, 3, 4, 5, 7 and 8 of Schedule V, Aeronautical Product Approvals, to this Subpart is the amount calculated on the basis of $40 per hour for each technical specialist assigned to the processing of the application, which amount shall not exceed the charge set out in column II of the item.

If, at the request of the applicant, an application is processed by technical specialists who would not otherwise be available under Department of Transport policy to process the application and who are dedicated on an exclusive, priority basis to the application, the charge imposed in respect of the issuance, renewal, amendment or endorsement on or after January 1, 1998 of a document referred to in column I of items 1, 3, 4, 5, 7 and 8 of Schedule V, Aeronautical Product Approvals, to this Subpart is the amount calculated on the basis of $120 per hour for each technical specialist assigned to the processing of the application.

In addition to a charge referred to in section 104.01 to 104.03, when an employee of the Department of Transport must travel outside Canada to process an application for the issuance, renewal, amendment or endorsement of a document, the following expenses that relate to the processing of the application are payable:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: transportation, lodging, meal and incidental expenses, as calculated in accordance with the rates set out in the Treasury Board Manual — Personnel Management Component, Employee Services, Chapter 1.1, unless, in respect of transportation and lodging, there is an agreement between the applicant and the Minister that the applicant provide transportation and lodging in lieu of payment; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: overtime expenses, as calculated in accordance with the appropriate collective agreement, for performing the service or travelling to perform the service on weekdays, when the total duty time for the day exceeds 7.5 hours, and on Saturdays, Sundays and Canadian statutory holidays.

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall, on request by an applicant, provide an estimate of the expenses referred to in subsection (1).

Section.Text: Subject to section 104.06, a charge imposed under this Subpart is payable in Canadian dollars at the time the service is commenced.
A charge is payable in Canadian dollars within 30 days after the date indicated on each invoice presented by the Minister for the service, in the case of a charge imposed in respect of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the processing of medical certificates referred to in item 21 of Schedule IV to this Subpart;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: aeronautical product approvals referred to in section 104.03; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the expenses referred to in section 104.04 in respect of the processing of applications outside Canada.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), in the case of a service that was commenced but not completed before January 1, 1998, the charge imposed in respect of the issuance, renewal, amendment or endorsement or, in the case of a medical certificate, the processing of a document referred to in column I of an item of Schedules I to VII to this Subpart is the lesser of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the charge payable under these Regulations, as they read immediately before January 1, 1998, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the charge set out in column II of the item.

Subsection.Text: In the case of a service that was commenced but not completed before January 1, 1998, the charge imposed in respect of the issuance, renewal, amendment or endorsement of a document referred to in column I of items 1, 3, 4, 5, 7 and 8 of Schedule V, Aeronautical Product Approvals, to this Subpart is the greater of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the charge payable under these Regulations, as they read immediately before January 1, 1998, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the amount calculated on the basis of $40 per hour starting January 1, 1998 for each technical specialist assigned to the processing of the application, which amount shall not exceed the charge set out in column II of the item.

Subsection.Text: In this section, aerial sightseeing flight means a flight carried out as part of a sightseeing operation or any other commercial flight in an aircraft conducted for the purpose of sightseeing from the air.

No person shall conduct an aerial sightseeing flight, or any portion of an aerial sightseeing flight, in the control zone of the Québec/Jean Lesage International Airport unless the flight commences at that airport.

Section.Text: This Subpart applies in respect of the following certificates:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an airport certificate issued under section 302.03;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a flight training unit operator certificate issued under section 406.11;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a manufacturer certificate issued under section 561.03;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an approved maintenance organization (AMO) certificate issued under section 573.02;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: an air operator certificate issued under section 702.07, 703.07, 704.07 or 705.07; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: an ATS operations certificate issued under section 801.05.

Subsection.Text: The applicant for, or the holder of, a certificate referred to in section 106.01 shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: appoint an individual as accountable executive to be responsible for operations or activities authorized under the certificate and accountable on their behalf for meeting the requirements of these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: notify the Minister of the name of the person appointed; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that the accountable executive submits to the Minister a signed statement that they accept the responsibilities of their position within 30 days after their appointment.

Subsection.Text: No person shall be appointed under subsection (1) unless they have control of the financial and human resources that are necessary for the activities and operations authorized under the certificate.

Section.Text: The responsibility and accountability of the accountable executive appointed under subsection 106.02(1) are not affected by the existence of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a person responsible for the maintenance control system appointed under paragraph 406.19(1)(a) or 706.03(1)(a);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a person responsible for maintenance appointed under paragraph 573.03(1)(a);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an operations manager referred to in section 702.07, 703.07, 704.07 or 705.07; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a maintenance manager referred to in section 702.07, 703.07, 704.07 or 705.07.

Section.Text: If a certificate holder is the holder of more than one certificate referred to in section 106.01, only one accountable executive shall be appointed under paragraph 106.02(1)(a) to be responsible for the operations or activities authorized under the certificates.

Subsection.Text: This Subpart, except paragraph 107.03(g), applies to an applicant for, or a holder of, one of the following certificates:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an approved maintenance organization (AMO) certificate issued under section 573.02 authorizing the holder to perform maintenance on an aircraft operated under Subpart 5 of Part VII; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an air operator certificate issued under section 705.07.

Subsection.Text: This Subpart applies to an applicant for, or a holder of, one of the following certificates:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an airport certificate issued under section 302.03; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an ATS operations certificate issued under section 801.05.

Subsection.Text: This Subpart, except sections 107.02 and 107.03, and the requirements set out in Subpart 4 of Part VI in respect of the safety management system apply to the holder of a private operator registration document.

Section.Text: The applicant for, or the holder of, a certificate referred to in subsections 107.01(1) or (2) shall establish and maintain a safety management system.
A safety management system shall include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a safety policy on which the system is based;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a process for setting goals for the improvement of aviation safety and for measuring the attainment of those goals;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a process for identifying hazards to aviation safety and for evaluating and managing the associated risks;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a process for ensuring that personnel are trained and competent to perform their duties;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a process for the internal reporting and analyzing of hazards, incidents and accidents and for taking corrective actions to prevent their recurrence;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a document containing all safety management system processes and a process for making personnel aware of their responsibilities with respect to them;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a quality assurance program;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: a process for conducting periodic reviews or audits of the safety management system and reviews or audits, for cause, of the safety management system; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: any additional requirements for the safety management system that are prescribed under these Regulations.

Section.Text: A safety management system shall be adapted to the size, nature and complexity of the operations, activities, hazards and risks associated with the operations of the holder of a document referred to in section 107.01.

Heading.TitleText: Subpart 9 — Aircraft under an Agreement for Transfer of Functions and Duties in Accordance with Article 83 bis of the Convention
Canada as the State of the Operator

Section.Text: These Regulations apply to a foreign-registered aircraft operated by a Canadian operator and to persons performing any functions or duties in respect of the aircraft if the requirements set out in these Regulations are specifically included under the terms of an agreement in force between Canada and another contracting State in accordance with Article 83 bis of the Convention.

Heading.TitleText: Canada as the State of Registry

Section.Text: These Regulations do not apply to a Canadian aircraft operated by a foreign operator or to persons performing any functions or duties in respect of the aircraft if the requirements set out in these Regulations are specifically excluded under the terms of an agreement in force between Canada and another contracting State in accordance with Article 83 bis of the Convention.

Subsection.Text: If the responsibility set out in Article 31 of the Convention to issue or to render valid a certificate of airworthiness for a Canadian aircraft is transferred to another contracting State in accordance with Article 83 bis of the Convention, the certificate of airworthiness for that aircraft shall cease to have effect upon commencement of the transfer.

The registered owner of the aircraft shall surrender the certificate of airworthiness to the Minister within seven days after the day on which the registered owner receives a notice from the Minister informing the registered owner of the coming into force of an agreement entered into in accordance with Article 83 bis of the Convention.

Heading.TitleText: Reinstatement of the Certificate of Airworthiness

Section.Text: Upon termination of a transfer to another contracting State, in accordance with Article 83 bis of the Convention, of the responsibility to issue or to render valid a certificate of airworthiness for a Canadian aircraft as set out in Article 31 of the Convention, the Minister shall reinstate the certificate of airworthiness if the registered owner of the aircraft complies with the applicable importation requirements specified in section 507.07.

If an agreement for the lease, charter or interchange of an aircraft or any similar arrangement, subject to an agreement in accordance with Article 83 bis of the Convention, is terminated on a date earlier than the date of expiration set out in the agreement or arrangement, the Canadian operator of the aircraft if it is a foreign-registered aircraft or the registered owner of the aircraft if it is a Canadian aircraft shall inform the Minister in writing of the actual date of termination within seven days of its occurrence.

If an aircraft that is subject to an agreement for the lease, charter or interchange of an aircraft or any similar arrangement is also subject to an agreement in accordance with Article 83 bis of the Convention to which Canada is not a party and is operated in Canada, any references in these Regulations to the “State of registry” with respect to the transferred responsibilities shall be interpreted to read “State of the operator”.

If Canada enters into an agreement in accordance with Article 83 bis of the Convention, the agreement and the provisions of this Subpart shall take precedence over any conflicting provisions of these Regulations.

Heading.TitleText: Part II — Aircraft Identification and Registration and Operation of a Leased Aircraft by a Non-Registered Owner

Section.Text: In this Part,

Definition.Text: aircraft identification plate means a fireproof plate that is attached to an aircraft pursuant to subsection 201.01(2) or (3) and that identifies the aircraft as a whole; (plaque d’identification d’aéronef)

approval number means a number assigned by the Minister to a manufacturer to identify the manufacturer as a manufacturer in respect of which a manufacturing approval has been granted in accordance with the applicable standards of airworthiness; (numéro d’agrément)

certificate of registration means a certificate of registration issued pursuant to section 202.25 and includes a certificate of registration issued by a contracting state or a foreign state that has an agreement in force with Canada that allows an aircraft that is registered in that foreign state to be operated in Canada; (certificat d’immatriculation)
commercial aircraft means an aircraft that is registered as a commercial aircraft pursuant to sections 202.16 and 202.17; (aéronef commercial)

identification plate means a fireproof plate that contains the identification information referred to in section 201.08, subsection 201.09(2), section 201.10 or subsection 201.11(2); (plaque d’identification)
marks means the nationality mark and the registration mark of an aircraft; (marques)
nationality mark means a symbol, letter or numeral, or a combination thereof, used by a state to indicate the nationality of aircraft that are registered in that state; (marque de nationalité)
registered, in respect of an aircraft, means registered pursuant to sections 202.16 and 202.17 or pursuant to the laws of a foreign state; (immatriculé)
registration mark means the combination of letters or letters and numerals that is issued in respect of an aircraft by a state as a registration identification; (marque d’immatriculation)

Definition.Code: se="200.01",df="{replica of a military aircraft}{réplique d’un aéronef militaire}"
Definition.Text: replica of a military aircraft means an aircraft of any scale that is a duplicate of an original military aircraft; (réplique d’un aéronef militaire)
special registration mark means a specific registration mark requested by the applicant; (marque d’immatriculation spéciale)
state aircraft means an aircraft that is registered as a state aircraft pursuant to sections 202.16 and 202.17; (aéronef d’État)
vintage aircraft means an aircraft that was manufactured prior to January 1, 1957. (aéronef d’époque)

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), this Part applies in respect of all Canadian aircraft operated in or outside Canada and section 202.01 also applies in respect of aircraft registered in a foreign state while operated in Canada.
Subpart 1 does not apply in respect of aircraft that, pursuant to subsection 202.13(1), are not required to be registered.

Heading.TitleText: Subpart 1 — Identification of Aircraft and Other Aeronautical Products

Subsection.Text: Except for an aircraft that is operated pursuant to an authorization issued under subsection 202.14(1), no person shall operate an aircraft in flight unless there is an aircraft identification plate attached to the aircraft in accordance with this Subpart.

Subject to subsection (3), where a person manufactures an aircraft or is an aircraft owner that obtains an authorization referred to in subsection (6), the manufacturer or aircraft owner, as the case may be, shall attach to the aircraft an aircraft identification plate that contains the information required by subsection (4)

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an aircraft other than an ultra-light aeroplane or a balloon, to the structure of the aircraft in a place where it is visible to a person on the ground or to a person at the main entrance or rearmost entrance door;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an ultra-light aeroplane, in a position near the pilot seat where it is readily visible; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a balloon, to the lower or upper girdle of the envelope in a place where it is readily visible prior to inflation.

Subsection.Text: Where the configuration of an aircraft precludes the attachment of an aircraft identification plate in a location specified in subsection (2), the Minister shall, on application in writing by the manufacturer or owner of the aircraft, authorize an alternative location for the attachment of the aircraft identification plate.
An aircraft identification plate attached to an aircraft shall have the following information permanently etched, engraved or stamped on it, namely,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the manufacturer and, if the manufacturer is an entity, its legal name;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the manufacturer’s model designation described in the type certificate or equivalent document;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the type certificate number or equivalent designation, if applicable; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the aircraft serial number.

Subsection.Text: Where an aircraft does not have an aircraft identification plate, the owner of the aircraft shall submit an application in writing to the Minister, including evidence that establishes the identity of the aircraft, for authorization to attach an aircraft identification plate to the aircraft.

On receipt of an application submitted in accordance with subsection (5) that includes evidence that establishes the identity of the aircraft, the Minister shall issue a written authorization to the owner that permits the owner to attach an aircraft identification plate to the aircraft.

Where an authorization is issued by the Minister pursuant to subsection (6), the owner of the aircraft shall attach an aircraft identification plate to the aircraft in accordance with subsection (2) or (3), as applicable.

Section.Text: Where a person modifies an aircraft in accordance with approved data, as that term is defined in section 571.06 of the Airworthiness Manual, and the modification results in a change in the model designation as specified by the manufacturer in the approved data, the person shall, before the next flight of the aircraft, attach to the aircraft, as near as possible to the original aircraft identification plate, an additional aircraft identification plate on which the following information is permanently etched, engraved or stamped:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the person who performed the modification and, if that person is an entity, its legal name;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the new model designation described in the supplemental type certificate or equivalent document;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the supplemental type certificate number or equivalent designation; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the aircraft serial number.

Heading.TitleText: Removal, Replacement and Attachment of, and Alteration of Information on, Aircraft Identification Plates

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (5), no person shall, without authorization from the Minister pursuant to subsection (3),

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: remove or replace an aircraft identification plate;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: attach to an aircraft an aircraft identification plate that was attached to another aircraft; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: alter the information on an aircraft identification plate.

Subsection.Text: Where the owner of an aircraft wishes to perform one of the actions referred to in subsection (1), the owner shall submit an application in writing to the Minister, including evidence that establishes the identity of the aircraft, for authorization to perform that action.

On receipt of an application submitted pursuant to subsection (2) that includes evidence that establishes the identity of the aircraft, the Minister shall issue a written authorization to the owner of the aircraft that permits the owner to perform the action in respect of which the authorization was sought.
Where an authorization is issued by the Minister pursuant to subsection (3), the owner of the aircraft shall perform the authorized action before the next flight of the aircraft.
A person may, without authorization from the Minister, remove an aircraft identification plate from an aircraft for the purpose of performing work on the aircraft.

Any person who removes an aircraft identification plate from an aircraft for the purpose of performing work on the aircraft shall, immediately after completing the work, re-attach the aircraft identification plate in accordance with subsection 201.01(2) or (3) or section 201.02, as applicable.

Heading.TitleText: Loss or Theft of or Damage to an Aircraft Identification Plate

Subsection.Text: Where an aircraft identification plate is lost, stolen or damaged, the owner of the aircraft shall submit an application in writing to the Minister, including evidence that establishes the identity of the aircraft, for authorization to attach a replacement aircraft identification plate to the aircraft.

On receipt of an application submitted pursuant to subsection (1) that includes evidence that establishes the identity of the aircraft, the Minister shall issue a written authorization to the owner of the aircraft that permits the owner to replace the lost, stolen or damaged aircraft identification plate.

Where an authorization is issued by the Minister pursuant to subsection (2), the owner of the aircraft shall, before the next flight of the aircraft, attach the replacement aircraft identification plate to the aircraft in accordance with subsection 201.01(2) or (3) or section 201.02, as applicable.

Heading.TitleText: Identification of Engines, Propellers, Life-limited Components, Appliances, Parts, Balloon Baskets and Burner Assemblies

Subsection.Text: No person shall operate an aircraft in flight unless each engine, propeller, life-limited component, appliance, part, balloon basket, or burner assembly for a balloon is identified in accordance with sections 201.06 to 201.11.

Subject to subsections 201.10(4) and (5), the identification information required under sections 201.08 to 201.11 shall be permanently etched, engraved or stamped directly on the aeronautical product or on an identification plate securely attached to it.
The manufacturer of an aircraft engine or an aircraft engine module shall place thereon, in accordance with subsections (2) and 201.05(2), the identification information required by section 201.08.

Identification information or an identification plate that contains such information shall be placed on an aircraft engine or on an aircraft engine module in an accessible location where it is not likely to become damaged, destroyed, lost or detached during normal operation or in an accident.

The manufacturer of a fixed pitch propeller, a propeller blade or a propeller hub shall place thereon, in accordance with subsections (2) and 201.05(2), the identification information required by section 201.08.

Identification information or an identification plate that contains such information shall be placed on a fixed pitch propeller, a propeller blade or a propeller hub in an accessible location where it is not likely to become damaged, destroyed, lost or detached during normal operation or in an accident.

Heading.TitleText: Information Relating to Aircraft Engines and Propellers

Section.Text: The identification information that shall be placed on an aircraft engine, aircraft engine module, fixed pitch propeller, propeller blade and propeller hub is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the manufacturer and, if the manufacturer is an entity, its legal name;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the manufacturer’s model designation as described in the type certificate or equivalent document;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the type certificate number or equivalent designation;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the aeronautical product serial number; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an aircraft engine, the power rating established for the engine by the manufacturer.

Subsection.Text: The manufacturer of a component for which a life limitation has been established by type design shall place thereon, in accordance with subsection 201.05(2), the identification information referred to in subsection (2).
The identification information that shall be placed on a component is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the part number of the component or an equivalent series of identifying characters; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the serial number of the component or an equivalent series of identifying characters.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (4) and (5), the manufacturer of an appliance or a part — including a part approved through the issuance of a part design approval — shall place on it, in the manner specified in subsection 201.05(2), the following identification information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name, trademark or symbol identifying the manufacturer and, if the manufacturer is an entity, its legal name;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the manufacturer’s approval number; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the part number of the appliance or part.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (4) and (5), the manufacturer of an appliance or a part for which a Canadian Technical Standard Order (CAN-TSO) design approval has been issued under section 521.109 shall place on it, in the manner specified in subsection 201.05(2), the following additional identification information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the manufacturer’s address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name, type or model designation of the appliance or part, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the serial number or the date of manufacture of the appliance or part;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the letters “CAN-TSO” followed by the applicable CAN-TSO number; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: any additional markings required by the applicable CAN-TSO.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (4) and (5), the manufacturer of an appliance or a part for which a type certificate has been issued by the Minister shall place on it, in the manner specified in subsection 201.05(2), the following additional identification information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the manufacturer’s address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name, type or model designation of the appliance or part, if any;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the serial number or the date of manufacture of the appliance or part; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the type certificate designation or a reference to the applicable standard of airworthiness.

Subsection.Text: The manufacturer of an auxiliary power unit shall, in the manner specified in subsection 201.05(2), place the identification information specified in subsection (1) on the unit in an accessible location where it is not likely to become damaged, destroyed, lost or detached during normal operation or in an accident.

If an appliance or a part is too small or if it is otherwise impractical to place on it some or all of the information required by subsection (1), (2) or (3), the information that cannot be placed on the appliance or part shall be placed on its container or on the authorized release certificate referred to in section 561.10 of Standard 561 — Standard for Approved Manufacturers.

Heading.TitleText: Balloon Basket and Burner Assembly Identification

Subsection.Text: The manufacturer of a balloon basket or a burner assembly for a balloon shall place thereon, in accordance with subsection 201.05(2), the identification information referred to in subsection (2).
The identification information that shall be placed on a balloon basket and on a burner assembly is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the manufacturer and, if the manufacturer is an entity, its legal name;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the part number of the basket or the burner assembly or an equivalent series of identifying characters; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the serial number of the basket or the burner assembly or an equivalent series of identifying characters.

Heading.TitleText: Removal and Replacement of Identification Plates and Alteration of Identification Information on Aeronautical Products Other Than Aircraft

Subsection.Text: No person shall remove or replace an identification plate attached to an aeronautical product that is not an aircraft or alter the identification information that is required by section 201.06, 201.07, 201.09, 201.10 or 201.11 to be on an aeronautical product that is not an aircraft unless a written application is submitted to the Minister, including evidence that establishes the identity of the aeronautical product, and a written authorization is issued by the Minister pursuant to subsection (4).
Subsection (1) does not apply to a person who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: removes an identification plate from an aeronautical product that is not an aircraft for the purpose of performing work on the aeronautical product; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: removes or replaces an identification plate or alters the identification information on an aeronautical product that is not an aircraft if the removal, replacement or alteration is made necessary by a modification or repair to the aeronautical product that is performed in accordance with section 571.06.

Subsection.Text: Any person who removes or replaces an identification plate or alters any identification information under subsection (2) shall, before the aeronautical product is used in flight, replace the identification plate or alter the identification information in accordance with section 201.06, 201.07, 201.09, 201.10 or 201.11, as applicable.

On receipt of an application referred to in subsection (1) that includes evidence that establishes the identity of the aeronautical product, the Minister shall issue a written authorization to the applicant that permits the applicant to remove or replace an identification plate or alter the identification information required to be on the aeronautical product pursuant to section 201.06, 201.07, 201.09, 201.10 or 201.11.

Where an authorization is issued by the Minister pursuant to subsection (4), the applicant shall, before the aeronautical product is used in flight, remove or replace the identification plate or alter the identification information required to be on the aeronautical product pursuant to section 201.06, 201.07, 201.09, 201.10 or 201.11.
Subject to subsection (2), no person shall operate an aircraft in Canada unless its marks are visible and are displayed

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a Canadian aircraft, in accordance with the requirements of the Aircraft Marking and Registration Standards; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an aircraft registered in a foreign state, in accordance with the laws of that foreign state.

Subsection.Text: On receipt of an application in writing, the Minister shall issue a written authorization permitting the operation in Canada of an aircraft that does not display its marks if the aircraft is to be operated for the purpose of an exhibition, air show, motion picture production or television production.
The Minister may specify conditions in the authorization governing the operation of an aircraft referred to in subsection (2) as are necessary for its safe and proper operation.

No person shall operate an aircraft pursuant to an authorization issued under subsection (2) unless the authorization is on board and the aircraft is operated in accordance with any conditions specified therein.

Heading.TitleText: Application for Issuance or Reservation of a Registration Mark

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall, on receipt of an application made in accordance with the Aircraft Marking and Registration Standards, issue to or reserve a registration mark or a special registration mark for an applicant.

A registration mark or a special registration mark issued pursuant to subsection (1) is cancelled if the aircraft is not registered in Canada within 12 months after the day on which the registration mark was issued.
The reservation of a registration mark or a special registration mark pursuant to subsection (1) expires 12 months after the day on which the mark was reserved.

A registration mark or a special registration mark that is reserved under subsection (1) may be applied to an aircraft that is registered on a foreign register but shall be kept covered until the mark is issued to that aircraft.

Subject to subsection (2), the nationality mark in respect of a Canadian aircraft is the letter “C” and the registration mark in respect of the aircraft is a combination of four letters specified by the Minister.
Subject to subsections (3) and (4), where an aircraft was registered in Canada before January 1, 1974 or is a vintage aircraft,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the nationality mark in respect of the aircraft is the letters “CF” and the registration mark in respect of the aircraft is a combination of three letters specified by the Minister; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the nationality mark in respect of the aircraft is the letter “C” and the registration mark in respect of the aircraft is a combination of four letters specified by the Minister.

Subsection.Text: Where the owner of an aircraft, other than a vintage aircraft, that has the letters “CF” as its nationality mark and a combination of three letters as its registration mark repaints the aircraft, the owner shall, prior to operating the aircraft, change the nationality mark to the letter “C” and the registration mark to the letter “F” followed by the combination of three letters.

Where the owner of an aircraft changes its marks pursuant to subsection (3) or the owner of a vintage aircraft changes its nationality mark from “C” to “CF” or from “CF” to “C”, followed by the appropriate registration mark, the owner shall, prior to operating the aircraft, notify the Minister in writing of the change, and the Minister shall change the marks accordingly in the Canadian Civil Aircraft Register and issue a new registration certificate to reflect the change.

Heading.TitleText: Removal or Change of Marks after Issuance of Continuing Registration

Subsection.Text: If a continuing certificate of registration has been issued in respect of an aircraft under paragraph 202.25(1)(d), no person shall remove the marks that are displayed on the aircraft unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the aircraft is permanently withdrawn from service;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the aircraft is being exported from Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the aircraft is undergoing or has undergone a transfer of legal custody and control to a person who is not qualified to be the registered owner of a Canadian aircraft;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: it is necessary to remove the marks for a maintenance operation;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the marks are removed and repainted on the aircraft under subsection 202.03(3) or (4);

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister requests that the marks be removed under section 202.61;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister requests that the marks be removed because they are unseemly or embarrassing;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister authorizes the removal of the marks under subsection 202.01(2); or

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the Minister permits the change of the marks under subsection (3).

Subsection.Text: If a continuing certificate of registration has been issued in respect of an aircraft under paragraph 202.25(1)(d), the owner may write to the Minister for permission to change the marks.
On receipt of a request to change marks, the Minister shall permit the change if the owner continues to meet the requirements of these Regulations.

Heading.TitleText: Variance from the Specifications for Marks for Former Military Aircraft and Replicas

Subsection.Text: Where an aircraft is a former military aircraft or a replica of a military aircraft, the Minister shall, on receipt of an application in accordance with the Aircraft Marking and Registration Standards, authorize an alternative size, location or colour for the display of its marks.
Where, pursuant to subsection (1), the Minister authorizes an alternative size, location or colour for the display of the marks of an aircraft, the marks shall be displayed accordingly.

Where the structural configuration of an aircraft precludes its marks from being displayed in accordance with section 202.01 or 202.07, the Minister shall, on receipt of an application in accordance with the Aircraft Marking and Registration Standards, authorize an alternative size or one or more alternative locations for the display of its marks.

Where, pursuant to subsection (1), the Minister authorizes an alternative size or one or more alternative locations for the display of the marks of an aircraft, the marks shall be displayed accordingly.

Heading.TitleText: Use of Marks Assigned to a Manufacturer

Subsection.Text: Where a manufacturer operates an aircraft within Canada for the purpose of a production test flight, a customer acceptance flight or a flight undertaken to complete the manufacturing process or to export the aircraft, in accordance with an authorization issued by the Minister pursuant to subsection 202.14(1), the manufacturer shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: affix the marks once to each side of the aircraft fuselage or cabin by a means, such as paint or decals, that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: ensures that the marks will not be detached or erased while the aircraft is in operation, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: allows the marks to be removed after the operation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: prior to the operation of the aircraft, inform the Minister in writing of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the marks that have been affixed to the aircraft,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the manufacturer’s model designation, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the serial number of the aircraft; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: after the completion of the operation of the aircraft for the purpose specified in this subsection,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: remove the marks, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: notify the Minister in writing of their removal.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subsection (1), the Minister may reserve a block of marks for a manufacturer.
This section does not apply in respect of an aircraft that is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a hang glider; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a parachute.

Subsection.Text: Except as otherwise authorized under subsection 202.14(1) or 202.43(1), no person shall operate an aircraft in Canada unless it is registered in Canada, in a contracting state or in a foreign state that has an agreement in force with Canada that allows an aircraft that is registered in that foreign state to be operated in Canada.

On receipt of an application in writing, the Minister shall issue a written authorization permitting the operation in Canada of an aircraft that is not registered and in the authorization may specify conditions governing the operation of the aircraft as necessary for its safe and proper operation, where

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the aircraft was manufactured in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the aircraft is operated by the manufacturer;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the aircraft is operated within Canada for the purpose of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a production test flight,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a customer acceptance flight, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a flight undertaken to complete the manufacturing process or to export the aircraft;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a registration mark has been reserved in respect of the aircraft pursuant to subsection 202.02(1);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the aircraft displays its marks in accordance with section 202.01 or 202.07; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the manufacturer is qualified to be the registered owner of a Canadian aircraft pursuant to section 202.15.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may specify conditions in the authorization governing the operation of the aircraft referred to in subsection (1) as are necessary for its safe and proper operation.
No person shall operate an aircraft pursuant to an authorization issued under subsection (1) unless the aircraft is operated in accordance with any conditions specified in the authorization.

Heading.TitleText: Qualifications to Be Registered Owner of a Canadian Aircraft

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), any Canadian is qualified to be the registered owner of a Canadian aircraft.
No individual is qualified to be the registered owner of a Canadian aircraft unless the individual is at least 16 years of age.
An entity that is not Canadian but is incorporated or formed under the laws of Canada or a province is qualified to be the registered owner of a private Canadian aircraft where

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the entity provides the Minister with a certified copy of the entity’s certificate of incorporation or other equivalent document issued under the laws of Canada or a province pursuant to which the entity was incorporated or formed;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the entity meets the requirements, specified in the Aircraft Marking and Registration Standards, respecting the keeping and preservation of records;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: subject to subsection (4), the entity meets the reporting requirements specified in the Aircraft Marking and Registration Standards; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: while the aircraft is registered in Canada, the flight time accumulated in Canada by the aircraft is not less than 60 per cent of the flight time accumulated by the aircraft at the end of each six-month period.

Subsection.Text: An entity referred to in subsection (3) may, in respect of an aircraft registered in the name of the entity, apply to the Minister in writing for an exemption from the applicable reporting requirements specified in the Aircraft Marking and Registration Standards, and the Minister shall issue the exemption, in writing, where the aircraft has been so registered since September 30, 1990.

Where an entity that is qualified to be the registered owner of an aircraft pursuant to subsection (3) ceases to meet the requirements set out in paragraphs (3)(b) to (d), the aircraft’s certificate of registration is cancelled.

Section.Text: The Minister, on receipt of an application in accordance with the Aircraft Marking and Registration Standards, shall register an aircraft where the owner of the aircraft

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is qualified to be the registered owner of a Canadian aircraft pursuant to section 202.15; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: meets the requirements set out in those standards.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (3) and (4), the Minister shall register an aircraft as

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a state aircraft;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a commercial aircraft; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a private aircraft.

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall register an aircraft with

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a provisional registration if the aircraft is not registered in Canada or in a foreign state and is to be operated for the purpose of importing it into Canada or for the purpose of transporting it from one location in Canada to another location in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a temporary registration if the documentation, record entries and other administrative steps necessary to grant a continuing registration cannot be completed immediately;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a continuing registration if the documentation, record entries and other administrative steps necessary to grant a continuing registration can be completed immediately; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an interim registration if the requirements of subsection 202.36(1) or (4) are satisfied.

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall register an aircraft as a state aircraft if it is a civil aircraft that is owned by and exclusively used in the service of a government in Canada.
The Minister shall register an aircraft as a commercial aircraft if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it is to be operated under Subpart 2, 3, 4 or 5 of Part VII or pursuant to an authorization issued under section 203.03; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: it is an aeroplane or helicopter that is to be operated pursuant to a flight training unit operator certificate issued under Subpart 6 of Part IV.

Section.Text: For the purpose of the registration in Canada of an aircraft, other than a balloon,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the fuselage, hull or an alternative structure of the aircraft establishes its identity; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: where the fuselage, hull or an alternative structure of the aircraft is scrapped, the aircraft is deemed to be destroyed.

Section.Text: For the purpose of the registration in Canada of a balloon,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the envelope of the balloon establishes its identity; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: where the envelope of a balloon is scrapped, the balloon is deemed to be destroyed.

Heading.TitleText: Issuance of a Certificate of Registration

Subsection.Text: Where the Minister registers an aircraft, the Minister shall issue to the registered owner of the aircraft

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a provisional certificate of registration if the aircraft has a provisional registration;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a temporary certificate of registration if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the documentation, record entries and other administrative steps necessary to issue a continuing registration cannot be completed immediately, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the Minister intends to replace a continuing certificate of registration pursuant to section 202.27 or amend or replace a certificate of registration pursuant to subsection 202.28(1), but the documentation, record entries and other administrative steps necessary to amend or replace the certificate cannot be completed immediately;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: an interim certificate of registration if the aircraft is deemed to be registered with an interim registration pursuant to subsection 202.36(1) or (4); or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: except in the circumstances described in subparagraph (b)(ii), a continuing certificate of registration if the aircraft has a continuing registration.

Subsection.Text: Where the Minister issues a temporary certificate of registration, the Minister may specify in the temporary certificate of registration a date on which the temporary registration expires.
A temporary certificate of registration expires or is cancelled, as the case may be, on the earliest of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date specified in the temporary certificate of registration,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the last day of the three-month period following the day on which the temporary certificate of registration was issued,

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the day on which there is a change in the legal custody and control of the aircraft, and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the day on which a continuing certificate of registration is issued in respect of the aircraft.

Heading.TitleText: Carrying Certificate of Registration on Board the Aircraft

Section.Text: No person shall operate an aircraft in Canada, other than an aircraft referred to in subsection 202.43(1), or a Canadian aircraft outside Canada unless the certificate of registration issued in respect of the aircraft is carried on board the aircraft.

Heading.TitleText: Certificate of Registration Lost or Destroyed

Section.Text: The Minister shall replace a lost or destroyed certificate of registration of a Canadian aircraft on receipt of a written application from the registered owner where the registered owner continues to meet the registration requirements referred to in section 202.16.

Heading.TitleText: Amendment or Replacement of Certificate of Registration

Subsection.Text: The Minister may request the return of a certificate of registration of a Canadian aircraft from the registered owner for the purpose of amending it or for the purpose of replacing it.

Where the Minister requests the return of a certificate of registration pursuant to subsection (1), the registered owner shall return it to the Minister within seven days after the day on which the request is received.

Heading.TitleText: Division IV — Transfer of Legal Custody and Control

Subsection.Text: Subject to Subpart 3, where the registered owner of a Canadian aircraft transfers any part of the legal custody and control of the aircraft, the certificate of registration of the aircraft is cancelled.

Where the registered owner of a Canadian aircraft transfers any part of the legal custody and control of the aircraft, the registered owner shall, by not later than seven days after the transfer, notify the Minister of the transfer in writing.
For the purposes of this Division, an owner has legal custody and control of a Canadian aircraft when the owner has complete responsibility for the operation and maintenance of the aircraft.

Subject to subsection (2), where any part of the legal custody and control of a Canadian aircraft is transferred and the new owner meets the requirements referred to in section 202.16, the aircraft is deemed to be registered with an interim registration in the name of the new owner.

Where any part of the legal custody and control of an aircraft referred to in subsection (1) is transferred for a second time, the aircraft is not deemed to be registered with an interim registration in the name of the new owner even if the new owner meets the requirements referred to in section 202.16.
The interim registration of an aircraft referred to in subsection (1) expires on the earliest of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the last day of the three-month period following the date of the transfer of any part of the legal custody and control of the aircraft,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the day on which there is a further transfer of any part of the custody and control of the aircraft, and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the day on which a continuing certificate of registration is issued in respect of the aircraft.

Subsection.Text: Where there is a change in the registered owner’s name, address or other information contained in the continuing certificate of registration, the aircraft is deemed to be registered with an interim registration if the requirements specified in the Aircraft Marking and Registration Standards are met.
The interim registration of an aircraft referred to in subsection (4) expires on the earliest of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the last day of the three-month period following the date of the change or amendment,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the day on which there is a transfer of any part of the legal custody and control of the aircraft, and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the day on which a continuing certificate of registration is issued in respect of the aircraft.

Subsection.Text: An interim certificate of registration may not be transferred.

If an aircraft is not registered in Canada or in a foreign state, no person shall operate it for the purpose of importing it into Canada or for the purpose of transporting it from one location in Canada to another location in Canada unless the person first obtains a provisional certificate of registration in accordance with the Aircraft Marking and Registration Standards in respect of the aircraft.

The Minister may specify in a provisional certificate of registration conditions governing the operation of the aircraft as necessary for its safe and proper operation, and the destination to which and the date or dates on which the aircraft may be operated.
A provisional certificate of registration expires or is cancelled, as the case may be, when the aircraft

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: arrives at the destination set out in the provisional certificate of registration or, if the provisional certificate of registration specifies that a test flight shall be performed, when the test flight is completed;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is operated on a date that is not specified in the provisional certificate of registration; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: is operated in a manner that is contrary to any condition specified in the provisional certificate of registration.

Section.Text: Where a Canadian aircraft is sold or leased to a person who is not qualified under section 202.15 to be the registered owner of a Canadian aircraft and the aircraft is not in Canada at the time of its sale or lease or it is understood by the vendor or lessor, as the case may be, that the aircraft is to be exported, the vendor or lessor shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: remove the Canadian marks from the aircraft and, if applicable, the aircraft address from the Mode S transponder and from the other avionics equipment of the aircraft at the time of the sale or lease;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: notify the Minister in writing, within seven days after the sale or lease, of the date of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the sale or lease,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the exportation, if applicable,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the removal of the Canadian marks, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the removal of the aircraft address from the Mode S transponder and from the other avionics equipment of the aircraft, if applicable;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: provide the Minister with a copy of all of the agreements that relate to the transfer of any part of the legal custody and control of the aircraft resulting from the sale or lease; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: return to the Minister the certificate of registration of the aircraft.

Heading.TitleText: Division V — Operation of Foreign Aircraft
Period of Time Present in Canada

Subsection.Text: Subject to section 203.03, no person shall operate in Canada an aircraft that is registered in a foreign state that has been present in Canada for a total of 90 days or more in the immediately preceding twelve-month period unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the foreign state is a contracting state;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the operator of the aircraft is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the foreign state,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: an individual who is not a Canadian citizen or a permanent resident but is a citizen or subject of the foreign state, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: an entity that is incorporated or otherwise formed under the laws of the foreign state; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the operator of the aircraft is an entity described in subparagraph (b)(iii), the aircraft is operated in Canada

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in accordance with an air operator certificate, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in any operation other than an operation that would require a private operator certificate if the aircraft were registered in Canada.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of calculating the 90-day period,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if the aircraft is present in Canada for any part of a calendar day, that part shall be counted as one day; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an aircraft is deemed to be present in Canada as soon as it enters Canadian airspace.

Heading.TitleText: Aircraft Registered in a Foreign State

Subsection.Text: Where an aircraft is registered in a foreign state that is not a contracting state or is not a state that has an agreement in force with Canada that allows an aircraft that is registered in that state to be operated in Canada, the Minister may, in writing, authorize the operation of the aircraft in Canada, and in the authorization may specify conditions governing the operation of the aircraft as necessary for its safe and proper operation.

No person shall operate an aircraft pursuant to an authorization issued under subsection (1) unless the authorization is on board and the aircraft is operated in accordance with any conditions specified in the authorization.
The Minister may request that the owner of an aircraft inform the Minister, in writing, of the location of the aircraft and whether or not the aircraft is serviceable.
Where the Minister makes a request pursuant to subsection (1), the owner shall comply with the request by not later than seven days after receiving it.
Where, pursuant to subsection (1), the owner of an aircraft informs the Minister that the aircraft is not serviceable, the owner shall inform the Minister

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an aircraft that will be returned to service, of the place at which and the estimated date on which it will be returned to service; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an aircraft that is permanently withdrawn from service, of whether or not the aircraft has been or will be disposed of and the manner of disposal.

Section.Text: Where the name or address of a registered owner of a Canadian aircraft changes, the registered owner shall, by not later than seven days after the change, notify the Minister in writing of the change.

Heading.TitleText: Loss of Qualification to Be Registered Owner

Section.Text: Every registered owner of a Canadian aircraft shall, within seven days after any change in circumstances as a result of which the owner is no longer qualified to be the registered owner of the aircraft under section 202.15, notify the Minister in writing of the change.

Heading.TitleText: Division VIII — Cancellation of Certificate of Registration
Conditions Where Certificate of Registration Is Cancelled

Subsection.Text: In addition to the circumstances set out in subsections 202.15(5), 202.35(1), 202.37(3) and 202.58(2) and sections 202.59 and 202.60, the certificate of registration of a Canadian aircraft is cancelled where

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an individual who is a registered owner of the aircraft dies;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an entity that is a registered owner of the aircraft is wound up, dissolved or amalgamated with another entity;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the lease termination date specified in the most recent lease received by the Minister and submitted in connection with an application for the registration of an aircraft referred to in section 202.16 is extended and the Minister is not informed of that fact in writing within seven days after that lease termination date;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a registered owner ceases to be qualified to be a registered owner of the aircraft under section 202.15; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: except in the case of an aircraft undergoing restoration or an ultra-light aeroplane, the aircraft has not been operated in flight during the last five years.

Subsection.Text: Where the document pursuant to which a registered owner of an aircraft has legal custody and control of the aircraft ceases to be in effect, the certificate of registration of the aircraft is cancelled unless the registered owner

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: retains legal custody and control of the aircraft after the document ceases to be in effect; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: submits to the Minister, within seven days after the day on which the document ceases to be in effect,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: notification of the fact that the document is no longer in effect, specifying the day on which it ceased to be in effect, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a copy of the new document under which the registered owner retains legal custody and control of the aircraft.

Heading.TitleText: Notification Regarding Destroyed or Missing Aircraft

Subsection.Text: Every registered owner of a Canadian aircraft shall, within seven days after becoming aware of the fact that any of the following events has occurred, notify the Minister in writing if the aircraft

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is destroyed;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is permanently withdrawn from use;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: is missing and the search for the aircraft is terminated; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: has been missing for 60 days or more.
