Paragraph.Text: aerodromes, including heliports, that are used primarily for helicopter operations; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: aerodromes that are used as temporary installations for the purpose of providing emergency services, such as forest fire suppression, law enforcement activities, and search and rescue operations, and responding to a medical emergency.

Section.Text: The proponent shall consult with the interested parties in accordance with the requirements of this Subpart.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of this Subpart, the interested parties are the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: if a built-up area of a city or town is located within a radius of 4 000 m from the location of the proposed aerodrome work,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the Minister,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the providers of air navigation services,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the operator of a certified or registered aerodrome located within a radius of 30 nautical miles from the location of the proposed aerodrome work,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the authority responsible for a protected area located within the radius of 4 000 m from the location of the proposed aerodrome work,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: any local land use authority where the proposed aerodrome work is to be carried out, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: members of the public who are within the radius of 4 000 m from the location of the proposed aerodrome work; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in any other case,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the Minister,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the providers of air navigation services,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the operator of a certified or registered aerodrome located within a radius of 30 nautical miles from the location of the proposed aerodrome work,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the authority responsible for a protected area located within a radius of 4 000 m from the location of the proposed aerodrome work,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: any local land use authority where the proposed aerodrome work is to be carried out, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: the owner of any land bordering the land on which the proposed aerodrome work is to be carried out.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subsection (1), the radius of 4 000 m from the location of the proposed aerodrome work shall be measured from the outer perimeter of the site of that location.

Section.Text: The proponent shall, at least 75 days before the expected start date of the proposed aerodrome work,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: provide a notice of the proposed aerodrome work to the interested parties referred to in subparagraphs 307.04(1)(a)(i) to (v) or paragraph 307.04(1)(b), as applicable; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case referred to in paragraph 307.04(1)(a), place a sign, in plain view of the public, at the location where the proposed aerodrome work is to be carried out.

Section.Text: The proponent shall include the following information on the notice and the sign:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a drawing showing the location of the proposed aerodrome work;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the proposed aerodrome work and its purpose;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the expected start date and completion date of the proposed aerodrome work;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a statement that the interested parties may provide their comments or objections to the proponent with respect to the proposed aerodrome work;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: contact information, including the mailing address, phone number and email address, for the contact persons to whom the interested parties may provide their comments or objections; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the period, which shall be at least 45 days, during which the interested parties may provide their comments or objections.

Section.Text: At the end of the period referred to in paragraph 307.06(f), the proponent shall prepare a summary report that includes the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the proposed aerodrome work;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the measures taken by the proponent to comply with the requirements of this Subpart;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the interested parties who were notified of the proposed aerodrome work; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a summary of the comments and objections received, the actions that the proponent proposes to take to address those comments and objections, and any objections that were not addressed, if applicable.

Section.Text: The proponent shall, as soon as practicable after the end of the period referred to in paragraph 307.06(f), provide the summary report to the Minister and make it available to the interested parties.
The proponent shall ensure that the summary report is available to the interested parties for at least five years after the date on which it is made available to them.

Subsection.Text: The proponent shall not start the proposed aerodrome work before the end of 30 days after the date on which the summary report is provided to the Minister.

If the proponent does not start the proposed aerodrome work within five years after the date on which the summary report is provided to the Minister, the proponent shall once again comply with the requirements of this Subpart.

Heading.TitleText: Part IV — Personnel Licensing and Training

Subsection.Text: In this Part,

Definition.Text: aeroplane does not include an ultra-light aeroplane; (avion)

Definition.Code: se="400.01",ss="1",df="{aviation document booklet}{carnet de documents d’aviation}"
Definition.Text: aviation document booklet means a booklet issued by the Minister in which certain documents issued under this Part can be affixed. (carnet de documents d’aviation)
balloon includes any lighter-than-air aircraft; (ballon)
booklet label means a label that is intended to be affixed in an aviation document booklet. (étiquette de carnet)
complex aeroplane means an aeroplane that has flaps and a constant-speed propeller and, except in the case of a seaplane, retractable landing gear; (avion complexe)

Definition.Code: se="400.01",ss="1",df="{dual instruction flight time}{temps d’instruction de vol en double commande}"
Definition.Text: dual instruction flight time means the flight time during which a person is receiving flight instruction from a person qualified in accordance with section 425.21 of the Personnel Licensing and Training Standards respecting Flight Training; (temps d’instruction de vol en double commande)

Definition.Code: se="400.01",ss="1",df="{employed on a full-time basis}{employé à temps plein}"
Definition.Text: employed on a full-time basis means working for a flight training unit on a continuous basis for at least the number of hours required to carry out the duties of the position intended to ensure the safe operation of the flight training service; (employé à temps plein)

examination means any written examination or written practical qualifications examination required by the personnel licensing standards for the issuance of a permit or licence or for the endorsement of a permit or licence with a rating; (examen)

Definition.Code: se="400.01",ss="1",df="{flight instructor experience}{expérience d’instructeur de vol}"
Definition.Text: flight instructor experience with respect to the experience requirements for a flight instructor rating for an aeroplane or helicopter, means the flight time accumulated in an aeroplane or helicopter

Paragraph.Code: se="400.01",ss="1",df="{flight instructor experience}{expérience d’instructeur de vol}",p1="a"
Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: by a holder of a flight instructor rating while providing dual flight instruction to applicants for

Subparagraph.Code: se="400.01",ss="1",df="{flight instructor experience}{expérience d’instructeur de vol}",p1="a",p2="i"
Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a pilot permit — recreational,

Subparagraph.Code: se="400.01",ss="1",df="{flight instructor experience}{expérience d’instructeur de vol}",p1="a",p2="ii"
Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a private or commercial pilot licence, or

Subparagraph.Code: se="400.01",ss="1",df="{flight instructor experience}{expérience d’instructeur de vol}",p1="a",p2="iii"
Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a night rating, VFR OTT rating, flight instructor rating — aeroplane, flight instructor rating — helicopter or flight instructor rating — aeroplane — aerobatic,

Paragraph.Code: se="400.01",ss="1",df="{flight instructor experience}{expérience d’instructeur de vol}",p1="b"
Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: by a holder of a foreign flight instructor rating issued by a contracting state, while providing dual flight instruction to an applicant for a permit, licence or rating equivalent to one of those referred to in paragraph (a), and

Paragraph.Code: se="400.01",ss="1",df="{flight instructor experience}{expérience d’instructeur de vol}",p1="c"
Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: by a Canadian Forces qualified flying instructor while providing dual flight instruction to persons undergoing initial flight training in the Canadian Forces; (expérience d’instructeur de vol)

Definition.Code: se="400.01",ss="1",df="{foreign licence validation certificate}{certificat de validation de licence étrangère}"
Definition.Text: foreign licence validation certificate means a certificate issued by the Minister pursuant to subsection 401.07(1); (certificat de validation de licence étrangère)
glider includes a powered glider; (planeur)

Definition.Code: se="400.01",ss="1",df="{ground school instruction}{instruction théorique au sol}"
Definition.Text: ground school instruction means classroom-type instruction generally given to one or more persons and covering an organized program of lectures, homework or self-paced study that adheres to an approved training program; (instruction théorique au sol)
high-performance aeroplane, with respect to a rating, means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an aeroplane that is specified in the minimum flight crew document as requiring only one pilot and that has a maximum speed (Vne) of 250 KIAS or greater or a stall speed (Vso) of 80 KIAS or greater, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an amateur-built aeroplane that has a wing loading greater than that specified in section 549.103 of the Airworthiness Manual; (avion à hautes performances)

Definition.Text: integrated course means a course of pilot training developed using the principles of instructional systems design, in which all instructional stages are completed as one continuous course and the flight training elements are interrelated and sequenced to provide for the efficient achievement of the learning objectives; (cours intégré)
invigilator means a person who is designated by the Minister to supervise a written examination; (surveillant)

main base means a location at which a flight training unit has personnel, aircraft and facilities for the operation of a flight training service and that is established as the principal place of business of the flight training unit; (base principale)

Definition.Code: se="400.01",ss="1",df="{minimum flight crew document}{documentrelatif à l’équipage de conduite minimal}"
Definition.Text: minimum flight crew document means a document, issued by the Minister, the Government of the United States or an aircraft manufacturer, that relates to an aircraft and that specifies the number of pilots required to operate the aircraft, but does not include an air operator certificate; (documentrelatif à l’équipage de conduite minimal)

operational control means the exercise of authority over the initiation, continuation, diversion or termination of a flight in the interest of the safety of the aircraft and the regularity and efficiency of the flight; (contrôle d’exploitation)

operations specifications, in respect of a flight training unit, means the operations specifications set out in a flight training unit operator certificate, and includes any amendment to the conditions of operation; (spécifications d’exploitation)

pre-flight briefing means a one-to-one practical briefing that is conducted just prior to a training flight for the purpose of ensuring that the trainee understands exactly what will take place during the flight; (exposé avant vol)

Definition.Code: se="400.01",ss="1",df="{preparatory ground instruction}{instruction au sol avant vol}"
Definition.Text: preparatory ground instruction means classroom-type instruction, generally on a one-to-one basis but not excluding group instruction, that is based on lesson plans contained in or developed from the applicable flight instructor guide; (instruction au sol avant vol)
satellite base means a location at which a flight training unit has personnel, aircraft and facilities for the operation of a flight training service on a temporary basis; (base satellite)

Definition.Code: se="400.01",ss="1",df="{solo flight time}{temps de vol en solo}"
Definition.Text: solo flight time means, with respect to the flight time necessary to acquire a permit, licence or rating,

Paragraph.Code: se="400.01",ss="1",df="{solo flight time}{temps de vol en solo}",p1="a"
Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a pilot, the flight time during which the pilot is the sole flight crew member, and

Paragraph.Code: se="400.01",ss="1",df="{solo flight time}{temps de vol en solo}",p1="b"
Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a student pilot permit holder, the flight time during which the holder is the sole occupant of an aircraft while under the direction and supervision of the holder of an instructor rating for the appropriate category of aircraft; (temps de vol en solo)

Definition.Text: sub-base means a location at which a flight training unit positions aircraft and personnel and from which operational control is exercised in accordance with the flight training operations manual and operational control system; (base secondaire)
training flight means a dual instruction flight or a solo practice flight that is conducted under the direction and supervision of a flight instructor; (vol d’entraînement)
ultra-light aeroplane includes a powered parachute and a powered para-glider. (avion ultra-léger)

Subsection.Text: Any reference in this Part to a permit, licence, rating or foreign licence validation certificate is a reference to a valid Canadian permit, licence, rating or foreign licence validation certificate.
Any reference in this Part to “military” is a reference to the Canadian Forces.
Except as authorized by an invigilator, no person shall, or shall attempt to, in respect of a written examination,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: copy or remove from any place all or any portion of the text of the examination;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: give to or accept from any person a copy of all or any portion of the text of the examination;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: give help to or accept help from any person during the examination;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: complete all or any portion of the examination on behalf of any other person; or

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: use any aid or written material during the examination.

Subsection.Text: A person who commits an act prohibited under subsection (1) fails the examination and may not take any other examination for a period of one year.
A person who uses a hand-held calculator during an examination shall use a hand-held calculator whose memory is cleared before and after the examination in the presence of the invigilator.
A person who uses a hand-held electronic computer during an examination shall use a hand-held electronic computer

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that has been specifically designed for flight operations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that has been approved by the Minister for examination purposes; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: whose memory is cleared before and after the examination in the presence of the invigilator.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (3), written examinations, including all sections of a sectionalized examination, that are required for the issuance of a permit or licence or for the endorsement of a permit or licence with a rating shall be completed during the 24-month period preceding the date of the application for the permit, licence or rating.
Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of examinations that are required for the issuance of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a student pilot permit; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an airline transport pilot licence if examinations were previously written

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: for the endorsement of a type rating, a mark of 70 per cent or higher was obtained on the examination and the type rating was issued;

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: for the issuance of the former senior commercial pilot licence, a mark of 70 per cent or higher was obtained on the examination and the senior commercial pilot licence was issued; or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: for the issuance of an airline transport pilot licence — aeroplane, an airline transport pilot licence — aeroplane integrated course was successfully completed during the 5-year period preceding the date of the application for the licence and a course completion certificate was issued.

Subsection.Text: The regulatory requirements examination referred to in subsection 566.03(5) of Standard 566 — Aircraft Maintenance Engineer Licensing and Training that is required for the issuance of an aircraft maintenance engineer (AME) licence shall be completed during the 12-month period immediately following the date on which the application for the licence is accepted by the Minister.

Subject to subsections (2) and (6), a person who fails an examination or a section of a sectionalized examination required for the issuance of a flight crew permit, licence, rating or foreign licence validation certificate is ineligible to rewrite the examination or the failed section for a period of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a first failure, 14 days;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a second failure, 30 days; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a third or subsequent failure, 30 days plus an additional 30 days for each failure in excess of two failures, up to a maximum of 180 days.

Subsection.Text: A person who fails the Student Pilot Permit or Private Pilot Licence for Foreign and Military Applicants, Aviation Regulations (PSTAR) examination is eligible to rewrite the examination at any time after the person has received notice of the failure and has reviewed their weak knowledge areas.

A person who fails an examination required for the issuance of an aircraft maintenance engineer (AME) licence or rating is eligible to rewrite the examination in accordance with the criteria specified in Chapter 566 of the Airworthiness Manual.
A person who passes a sectionalized examination but fails one or more sections of that examination shall rewrite the failed section or sections in one sitting.

Where a person requests to rewrite an examination, the Minister shall inform the person in writing of the date on which the person may rewrite the examination and whether the person is required to provide evidence of further study or instruction before rewriting the examination.

If a person submits a request to the Minister to shorten the period between examination attempts, the Minister shall grant the request on receipt of confirmation that the person has reviewed their weak knowledge areas.

Heading.TitleText: Authorization to Operate Flight Training Service under NAFTA

Subsection.Text: A person who is a citizen, permanent resident or corporation of the United States of America or Mexico and who is eligible to operate a flight training service in Canada in accordance with Chapter 12 and Annex I — Canada of the North American Free Trade Agreement shall, prior to operating the service, obtain from the Minister an authorization to operate the service. The request for the authorization shall be in the form and shall contain the information specified in the Personnel Licensing and Training Standards respecting Flight Training Units.

Subject to section 6.71 of the Act, the Minister shall, on receipt of a request referred to in subsection (1) and where the requirements of the Personnel Licensing and Training Standards respecting Flight Training Units are met, issue an authorization containing the conditions under which the flight training service may be operated.

An authorization referred to in subsection (1) is required in addition to a flight training unit operator certificate for those persons who are required to hold a flight training unit operator certificate pursuant to Subpart 6.

Section.Text: [Reserved, SOR/2008-140, s. 1]
The holder of a permit or licence shall notify the Department of Transport of any change of permanent address within seven days after the change.

Heading.TitleText: Subpart 1 — Flight Crew Permits, Licences and Ratings

Section.Text: Any reference in this Subpart to the personnel licensing standards is a reference to the Personnel Licensing and Training Standards respecting Flight Crew Permits, Licences and Ratings.
[Reserved, SOR/2014-15, s. 1]

Heading.TitleText: Requirement to Hold a Flight Crew Permit, Licence or Rating or a Foreign Licence Validation Certificate

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), no person shall act as a flight crew member or exercise the privileges of a flight crew permit, licence or rating unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person holds the appropriate permit, licence or rating;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the permit, licence or rating is valid;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the person holds the appropriate medical certificate; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the person can produce the permit, licence or rating, and the certificate, when exercising those privileges.

Subsection.Text: No person shall exercise the privileges of a foreign licence validation certificate unless the person

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: holds the appropriate foreign licence validation certificate;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has signed the certificate; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: can produce the certificate when exercising those privileges.

Subsection.Text: A person who holds a military flight crew permit, licence or rating or a flight crew permit, licence or rating issued by a contracting state other than Canada may act as a flight crew member or exercise the privileges of a flight crew permit, licence or rating for the sole purpose of the person’s flight test where

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the test is conducted in accordance with section 401.15; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: no passenger is carried on board the aircraft.

Heading.TitleText: Flight Crew Members of Aircraft Registered in Contracting States Other Than Canada

Section.Text: No person shall act as a flight crew member or exercise the privileges of a flight crew licence in Canada in an aircraft registered in a contracting state other than Canada, unless the person holds, and can produce while so acting or while exercising such privileges,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a flight crew permit or licence issued under this Subpart; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a flight crew licence, or a document equivalent to a foreign licence validation certificate, that is issued under the laws of the contracting state.

Subsection.Text: Notwithstanding any other provision of this Subpart, no holder of a flight crew permit, licence or rating, other than the holder of a flight engineer licence, shall exercise the privileges of the permit, licence or rating unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the holder has acted as pilot-in-command or co-pilot of an aircraft within the five years preceding the flight; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: within the 12 months preceding the flight

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the holder has completed a flight review, in accordance with the personnel licensing standards, conducted by the holder of a flight instructor rating for the same category of aircraft,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the flight instructor who conducted the flight review has certified in the holder’s personal log that the holder meets the skill requirements for the issuance of the permit or licence set out in the personnel licensing standards, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the holder has successfully completed the appropriate examination specified in the personnel licensing standards.

Subsection.Text: Notwithstanding any other provision of this Subpart, no holder of a flight crew permit or licence, other than the holder of a flight engineer licence, shall exercise the privileges of the permit or licence in an aircraft unless the holder

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has successfully completed a recurrent training program in accordance with the personnel licensing standards within the 24 months preceding the flight; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: where a passenger other than a flight test examiner designated by the Minister is carried on board the aircraft, has completed, within the six months preceding the flight,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of an aircraft other than a glider or a balloon, in the same category and class of aircraft as the aircraft, or in a Level B, C or D simulator of the same category and class as the aircraft, at least

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: five night or day take-offs and five night or day landings, if the flight is conducted wholly by day, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: five night take-offs and five night landings, if the flight is conducted wholly or partly by night,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a glider, at least

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: five take-offs and five landings in a glider, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: two take-offs and two landings in a glider with the holder of a flight instructor rating — glider and obtained a certification of competence to carry passengers on board a glider from that holder in accordance with the personnel licensing standards, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a balloon, at least

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: five landings in a balloon by day and five take-offs in a balloon by day or night, if the flight is conducted by day, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: five landings in a balloon by day and five take-offs in a balloon by night, if the flight is conducted partly by night.

Subsection.Text: No holder of an instrument rating shall exercise the privileges referred to in section 401.47 unless the holder has

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: within the 12 months preceding the flight, successfully completed an instrument rating flight test in an aircraft or in a Level B, C or D simulator of the same group as the aircraft;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: within the six months preceding the flight, acquired six hours of instrument time and completed six instrument approaches to the minima specified in the Canada Air Pilot in an aircraft, in actual or simulated instrument meteorological conditions, or in a Level B, C or D simulator of the same category as the aircraft or in a flight training device under the supervision of a person who holds the qualifications referred to in subsection 425.21(9) of the Personnel Licensing and Training Standards respecting Flight Training;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: within the six months preceding the flight, acquired six hours of instrument time and completed six instrument approaches to the minima specified in the Canada Air Pilot in an aircraft, in actual or simulated instrument meteorological conditions, while acting as a flight instructor conducting training in respect of the endorsement of a flight crew licence or permit with an instrument rating; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: successfully completed, for an aircraft, a competency check or pilot proficiency check for which the validity period has not expired and that included the instrument procedures portion of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the Flight Test Guide — Competency Check (Private Operators), published by the Minister, in respect of aircraft operated under Subpart 4 of Part VI, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the following schedules to the Commercial Air Services Standards in respect of the corresponding aircraft operated under Subparts 2 to 5 of Part VII:

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: Schedule I to Standard 722 — Aerial Work in respect of aeroplanes operated under Subpart 2,

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: Schedule II to Standard 722 — Aerial Work in respect of helicopters operated under Subpart 2,

Clause.Label: (C)
Clause.Text: Schedule I to section 723.88 of Standard 723 — Air Taxi — Aeroplanes in respect of aeroplanes operated under Subpart 3,

Clause.Label: (D)
Clause.Text: the schedule to section 723.88 of Standard 723 — Air Taxi — Helicopters in respect of helicopters operated under Subpart 3,

Clause.Label: (E)
Clause.Text: Schedule I or II to section 724.108 of Standard 724 — Commuter Operations — Aeroplanes in respect of aeroplanes operated under Subpart 4,

Clause.Label: (F)
Clause.Text: the Helicopter Schedule to section 724.108 of Standard 724 — Commuter Operations — Helicopters in respect of helicopters operated under Subpart 4, or

Clause.Label: (G)
Clause.Text: Schedule I, II or III to section 725.106 of Standard 725 — Airline Operations — Aeroplanes in respect of aeroplanes operated under Subpart 5.

Subsection.Text: No holder of a flight engineer licence shall exercise the privileges set out in section 401.37 unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the holder has acted as flight engineer on board an aircraft within the five years preceding the flight or has met the written examination requirements for the licence within the 12 months preceding the flight; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: where a passenger or a trainee is carried on board the aircraft, the holder has, within the six months preceding the flight, acted as flight engineer

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in an aircraft of the same type, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in a synthetic flight trainer for an aircraft of the same type.

Subsection.Text: No holder of a second officer rating shall exercise the privileges set out in section 401.53 unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the holder has acted as a second officer on board an aircraft within the five years preceding the flight; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: where a passenger or a trainee is carried on board the aircraft, the holder has, within the six months preceding the flight, acted as a second officer in

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: an aircraft of the same type, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a synthetic flight trainer for an aircraft of the same type.

Subsection.Text: No holder of a flight instructor rating — ultra-light aeroplane shall exercise the privileges set out in section 401.88 unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the holder has

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: acted as pilot-in-command or co-pilot of an aircraft within the five years preceding the flight, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: met the written examination requirements for the rating within the 12 months preceding the flight;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the holder has successfully completed a recurrent training program in accordance with the personnel licensing standards within the 24 months preceding the flight; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the holder has, where a student is carried on board the aeroplane, completed at least five take-offs and five landings in an ultra-light aeroplane of the same control configuration within the six months preceding the flight.

Heading.TitleText: Issuance and Endorsement of Flight Crew Permits, Licences and Ratings

Subsection.Text: Subject to section 6.71 of the Act, the Minister shall, on receipt of an application submitted in the form and manner specified in the personnel licensing standards, issue a flight crew permit or licence to the applicant or endorse the applicant’s flight crew permit or licence with a rating if the applicant provides documentation to the Minister that establishes

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant’s citizenship;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that the applicant meets the applicable requirements set out in the personnel licensing standards in respect of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: minimum age,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: medical fitness,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: knowledge,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: experience, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: skill; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: that the applicant has successfully completed, within the applicable period specified in the personnel licensing standards preceding the date of application for the permit, licence or rating, a flight test in accordance with the personnel licensing standards.

Subsection.Text: An application shall also include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a licence or a permit, one photograph of the applicant that meets the requirements of subsection 421.06(3) of the personnel licensing standards; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a licence, documentation establishing that the applicant demonstrated, by means of an evaluation, their ability to speak and understand English or French, or both, at the operational or expert level in accordance with the language proficiency scale set out in the table to subsection 421.06(4) of the personnel licensing standards.

Subsection.Text: The certification of additional privileges on a permit or licence expires at the end of the period specified on the licence or permit or on receipt of a new permit or licence granting those privileges, whichever is earlier.

The Minister shall extend the validity period of an instrument rating or a flight instructor rating for a period of not more than 90 days beginning on the day on which the rating would otherwise expire, if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the application for extension of the rating is made while the rating is still valid; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant demonstrates that there has been no reasonable opportunity to renew the rating within the 90 days before the day on which the rating would otherwise expire.

Subsection.Text: Subject to section 6.71 of the Act, if the holder of a foreign flight crew licence issued by a contracting state other than Canada meets the applicable requirements set out in the personnel licensing standards and does not reside in Canada, the Minister shall, on receipt of an application submitted in the form and manner set out in those standards, issue a foreign licence validation certificate to the holder of the licence.
The Minister shall, in accordance with the personnel licensing standards, specify in a foreign licence validation certificate the privileges that may be exercised by the holder of the certificate.

Every applicant for, and every holder of, a flight crew permit, licence or rating shall maintain a personal log in accordance with subsection (2) and with the personnel licensing standards for the documentation of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: experience acquired in respect of the issuance of the flight crew permit, licence or rating; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: recency.

Subsection.Text: A personal log that is maintained for the purposes referred to in paragraphs (1)(a) and (b) shall contain the holder’s name and the following information in respect of each flight:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date of the flight;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the type of aircraft and its registration mark;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the flight crew position in which the holder acted;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the flight conditions with respect to day, night, VFR and IFR;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a flight in an aeroplane or helicopter, the place of departure and the place of arrival;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a flight in an aeroplane, all of the intermediate take-offs and landings;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the flight time;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a flight in a glider, the method of launch used for the flight; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a flight in a balloon, the method of inflation used for the flight.

Subsection.Text: No person shall make an entry in a personal log unless the person

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is the holder of the log; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has been authorized to make the entry by the holder of the log.

Heading.TitleText: Credits towards Requirements for a Flight Crew Permit, Licence or Rating

Section.Text: The Minister shall, in accordance with the personnel licensing standards, credit the flight time acquired by a person in acting as a flight crew member towards the issuance of the person’s flight crew permit or licence or the endorsement of the person’s flight crew licence or permit with a rating.
[Reserved, SOR/2014-15, s. 3]

Heading.TitleText: Airline Transport Licence — Training Program and Recording of Time

Subsection.Text: No person shall record in a personal log the flight time acquired by a co-pilot while acting as pilot-in-command under supervision, unless the flight time

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: was acquired in accordance with an airline transport pilot licence training program approved by the Minister pursuant to subsection (2) and carried out in accordance with the personnel licensing standards; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is recorded in the personal log in accordance with the personnel licensing standards.

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall approve a training program referred to in paragraph (1)(a) if the applicable requirements set out in the personnel licensing standards are met.

Heading.TitleText: Validity of Flight Crew Permits and Licences

Subsection.Text: A flight crew permit or licence that is issued in the form of a booklet label is not valid unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the label is affixed in an aviation document booklet;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the booklet number displayed on the label matches the number of the booklet; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the booklet is signed by the holder.

Subsection.Text: The validity period of a flight crew permit or licence that is issued in the form of a booklet label starts on the day on which it is issued and ends on the expiry date of the aviation document booklet in which it is affixed.

The expiry date of an aviation document booklet that has a flight crew permit affixed in it but does not have a flight crew licence affixed in it is the first day of the sixty-first month following the day on which the booklet was issued.
The expiry date of an aviation document booklet that has a flight crew licence affixed in it is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the first day of the sixty-first month following the day on which the booklet was issued, if the application for the licence included documentation establishing that the holder demonstrated an expert level ability during their language proficiency evaluation; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the first day of the sixty-first month following the day on which the holder’s language proficiency evaluation was conducted, if the application for the licence included documentation establishing that the holder demonstrated an operational level ability during the evaluation.

Subsection.Text: A flight crew permit or licence that was not issued in the form of a booklet label and is listed in column 1 of the table this subsection is valid until the day set out in column 2.

Prior to taking a written examination, an applicant for a flight crew permit, licence or rating shall meet the prerequisites for the examination set out in the personnel licensing standards with respect to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: medical fitness;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: identification;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a recommendation from the flight instructor who is responsible for the training of the applicant; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: experience.

Subsection.Text: The applicant for a flight crew permit, licence or rating must be sufficiently competent in one of the official languages to be able to read the examination questions and to write the answers without assistance.

Section.Text: Prior to taking a flight test, an applicant for a flight crew permit, licence or rating shall meet the prerequisites for the test set out in the personnel licensing standards with respect to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: medical fitness;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: identification;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a recommendation from the flight instructor who is responsible for the training of the applicant;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: experience; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: for applicants for a commercial pilot licence — aeroplane or helicopter, knowledge.

Section.Text: No person shall conduct a flight test required for the issuance or renewal of a flight crew permit or licence or for the endorsement of a flight crew permit or licence with a rating unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: is designated by the Minister to conduct the flight test, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: meets the requirements of section 425.21 of the Personnel Licensing and Training Standards respecting Flight Training; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the flight test is conducted in accordance with

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: Subpart 8, in the case of an aeroplane or helicopter, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the personnel licensing standards, in any other case.

Section.Text: Where an applicant has failed a flight test, the applicant shall complete the remedial requirements specified in the personnel licensing standards prior to being retested.

Heading.TitleText: Failure of a Flight Test for a Rating Renewal

Subsection.Text: Where, during a flight test, the holder of a rating fails to meet the requirements specified in the personnel licensing standards for the lowest class of that rating, the Minister shall suspend the rating.

Where, during a flight test for a flight instructor rating, the holder of a rating fails to meet the requirements specified in the personnel licensing standards for renewal of the rating but meets the requirements for a lower class of that rating the Minister shall endorse the holder’s licence with the lower class of that rating.

Heading.TitleText: Examiner’s Endorsement of Personal Log — Gliders and Balloons

Subsection.Text: Where the applicant for a pilot licence — glider successfully completes the flight test required for the licence, the flight test examiner shall so endorse the applicant’s personal log, recording therein the method of launch that was used for the flight test and any other information specified in the personnel licensing standards.

Where the holder of a pilot licence — glider demonstrates, in accordance with the personnel licensing standards, additional methods of launch to an instructor who holds a flight instructor rating — glider, the instructor shall so endorse the holder’s personal log, recording therein the additional methods of launch used.

Where an applicant for a pilot licence — balloon successfully completes the flight test required for the licence, the flight test examiner shall so endorse the applicant’s personal log, recording therein the method of inflation that was used for the flight test and any other information specified in the personnel licensing standards.

Where the holder of a pilot licence — balloon demonstrates, in accordance with the personnel licensing standards, additional methods of inflation to an instructor who holds a flight instructor rating — balloon, the instructor shall so endorse the holder’s personal log, recording therein the additional methods of inflation used.
The holder of a student pilot permit may act as pilot-in-command of an aircraft of the category for which the permit is endorsed if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the flight is conducted for the purpose of the holder’s flight training;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the flight is conducted in Canada;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the flight is conducted under day VFR;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the flight is conducted under the direction and supervision of a person qualified to provide training toward the permit, licence or rating for which the pilot-in-command experience is required; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: no passenger is carried on board.

Subsection.Text: Despite paragraph (1)(c), the holder of a student pilot permit who is enrolled in an integrated course may act as pilot-in-command during a flight that is conducted under day or night VFR.

Section.Text: The holder of a pilot permit — gyroplane may, under VFR, act as

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: pilot-in-command of a gyroplane of a type for which the permit is endorsed with a rating; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: pilot-in-command or co-pilot of an aircraft for the sole purpose of the holder’s flight training or flight test where

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of flight training,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: it is conducted under the direction and supervision of a flight instructor qualified in accordance with section 425.21 of the Personnel Licensing and Training Standards respecting Flight Training, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: no passenger is carried on board, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a flight test,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: it is conducted in accordance with section 401.15, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: no passenger is carried on board.

Section.Text: The holder of a pilot permit — ultra-light aeroplane may, under day VFR,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: act as pilot-in-command of an ultra-light aeroplane with no other person on board;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: act as pilot-in-command of an ultra-light aeroplane with one other person on board if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the holder’s permit is endorsed with a passenger-carrying rating,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the ultra-light aeroplane has no restrictions against carrying another person, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the holder has completed training, including dual instruction and solo flight, on the class of ultra-light aeroplane being operated;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: act as pilot-in-command of an ultra-light aeroplane with one other person on board if the other person is a holder of a pilot licence or permit, other than a student pilot permit, that allows them to act as pilot-in-command of an ultra-light aeroplane; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: act as pilot-in-command of an aircraft for the sole purpose of the holder’s flight training or flight test if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of flight training,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: it is conducted under the direction and supervision of a flight instructor qualified in accordance with section 425.21 of the Personnel Licensing and Training Standards respecting Flight Training, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: no other person is carried on board, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a flight test,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: it is conducted in accordance with section 401.15, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: no passenger is carried on board.

Section.Text: The holder of a pilot permit — recreational — aeroplane may, under day VFR, act as

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: pilot-in-command of an aeroplane of a class and type in respect of which the permit is endorsed with a rating where

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the aeroplane is a single-engined aeroplane that is not a high-performance aeroplane,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the aeroplane is designed, or is authorized by a type certificate, to carry a maximum of four persons, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: no more than one passenger is carried on board;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: pilot-in-command of an ultra-light aeroplane; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: pilot-in-command or co-pilot of any aircraft for the sole purpose of the holder’s flight training or flight test where

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of flight training,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: it is conducted under the direction and supervision of a flight instructor qualified in accordance with section 425.21 of the Personnel Licensing and Training Standards respecting Flight Training, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: no passenger is carried on board, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a flight test,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: it is conducted in accordance with section 401.15, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: no passenger is carried on board.

Section.Text: The holder of a pilot permit — recreational — helicopter may, under day VFR, act as

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: pilot-in-command of a helicopter of a type specified in the personnel licensing standards in respect of which the permit is endorsed with a rating where

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the helicopter is a single-engined helicopter,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: no more than one passenger is carried on board; and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: no external loads are carried; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: pilot-in-command or co-pilot of any aircraft for the sole purpose of the holder’s flight training or flight test where

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of flight training,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: it is conducted under the direction and supervision of a flight instructor qualified in accordance with section 425.21 of the Personnel Licensing and Training Standards respecting Flight Training, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: no passenger is carried on board, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a flight test,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: it is conducted in accordance with section 401.15, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: no passenger is carried on board.

Section.Text: The holder of a pilot licence — glider may, under day VFR, act as

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: pilot-in-command of a glider in which no passenger is carried on board;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: pilot-in-command of a glider in which passengers are carried on board where

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the glider is launched by a method of launch endorsed by the holder of a flight instructor rating — glider in the holder’s personal log pursuant to subsection 401.18(1) or (2), and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the method of launch has been used by the holder for not less than three previous solo flights; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: pilot-in-command or co-pilot of any aircraft for the sole purpose of the holder’s flight training or flight test where

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of flight training,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: it is conducted under the direction and supervision of a flight instructor qualified in accordance with section 425.21 of the Personnel Licensing and Training Standards respecting Flight Training, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: no passenger is carried on board, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a flight test,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: it is conducted in accordance with section 401.15, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: no passenger is carried on board.

Section.Text: The holder of a pilot licence — balloon may, under VFR,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: act as pilot-in-command or co-pilot of a balloon that is inflated by a method of inflation endorsed by the holder of a flight instructor rating — balloon in the holder’s personal log pursuant to subsection 401.18(3) or (4) and that is of a type for which the licence is endorsed with a rating;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: act as pilot-in-command or co-pilot of any aircraft for the sole purpose of the holder’s flight training or flight test where

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of flight training,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: it is conducted under the direction and supervision of a flight instructor qualified in accordance with section 425.21 of the Personnel Licensing and Training Standards respecting Flight Training, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: no passenger is carried on board, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a flight test,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: it is conducted in accordance with section 401.15, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: no passenger is carried on board; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: conduct a take-off in a balloon within a built-up area of a city or town where the holder complies with section 602.13 and the applicable requirements set out in the personnel licensing standards.

Section.Text: The holder of a private pilot licence — aeroplane may act as

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: pilot-in-command or co-pilot of an aeroplane of a class and type in respect of which the licence is endorsed with ratings;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: pilot-in-command of an ultra-light aeroplane; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: pilot-in-command or co-pilot of any aircraft for the sole purpose of the holder’s flight training or flight test where

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of flight training,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: it is conducted under the direction and supervision of a flight instructor qualified in accordance with section 425.21 of the Personnel Licensing and Training Standards respecting Flight Training, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: no passenger is carried on board, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a flight test,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: it is conducted in accordance with section 401.15, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: no passenger is carried on board.

Section.Text: The holder of a private pilot licence — helicopter may act as

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: pilot-in-command or co-pilot of a helicopter of a type in respect of which the licence is endorsed with ratings; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: pilot-in-command or co-pilot of any aircraft for the sole purpose of the holder’s flight training or flight test where

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of flight training,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: it is conducted under the direction and supervision of a flight instructor qualified in accordance with section 425.21 of the Personnel Licensing and Training Standards respecting Flight Training, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: no passenger is carried on board, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a flight test,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: it is conducted in accordance with section 401.15, and

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: no passenger is carried on board.

Heading.TitleText: Aeroplanes and Helicopters — Reimbursement of Costs Incurred in respect of a Flight

Subsection.Text: The holder of a private pilot licence shall not act as the pilot-in-command of an aeroplane or helicopter for hire or reward unless the conditions set out in subsection (2), (3), (4) or (5), as applicable, are met.
The holder of a private pilot licence may receive reimbursement for costs incurred in respect of a flight if the holder

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is the owner or operator of the aircraft;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: conducts the flight for purposes other than hire or reward;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: carries passengers only incidentally to the purposes of the flight; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: receives a reimbursement that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: is provided only by the passengers referred to in paragraph (c), and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: is for the purpose of sharing the costs of fuel, oil and fees charged against the aircraft in respect of the flight, as applicable.

Subsection.Text: The holder of a private pilot licence may receive reimbursement from the holder’s employer for costs incurred in respect of a flight if the holder

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is employed on a full-time basis by the employer for purposes other than flying;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: conducts the flight on the employer’s business and the flight is incidental to the execution of the holder’s duties; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: receives a reimbursement that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of an aircraft owned by the holder, is paid at a rate based on distance travelled or number of hours flown and that does not exceed the total of the holder’s direct operating costs and the fees charged against the aircraft in respect of the flight, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a rental aircraft, does not exceed the total of the holder’s rental costs, direct operating costs and the fees charged against the aircraft in respect of the flight.

Subsection.Text: The holder of a private pilot licence may receive reimbursement from a charitable, not-for-profit or public security organization in respect of a flight conducted by the holder as a volunteer for that organization if the reimbursement

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an aircraft owned by the holder, is paid at a rate based on distance travelled or number of hours flown and does not exceed the total of the holder’s direct operating costs and the fees charged against the aircraft in respect of the flight; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a rental aircraft, does not exceed the total of the holder’s rental costs, direct operating costs and the fees charged against the aircraft in respect of the flight.

Subsection.Text: The holder of a private pilot licence who is a farmer, as defined in section 700.01, may conduct aerial work involving the dispersal of products for agricultural purposes for hire or reward if the holder

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: does not hold an air operator certificate;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: owns the aircraft that is used to disperse the products;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: has at least 150 hours of flight time as pilot-in-command, including at least 25 hours of flight time in the type of aircraft being used;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: ensures that no more than the minimum number of crew members needed to disperse the products is on board the aircraft;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: ensures that the dispersal takes place within 25 miles of the centre of the holder’s farm; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: ensures that no dispersal is conducted within a control zone without the authority of the appropriate air traffic control unit.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (3), the holder of a commercial pilot licence — aeroplane may, by day or night,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: exercise the privileges of a private pilot licence — aeroplane;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: exercise the privileges of a VFR OTT rating;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: while engaged in providing a commercial air service by means of an aeroplane of a class and type in respect of which the licence is endorsed with ratings, act as

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: pilot-in-command of the aeroplane, if the minimum flight crew document for the aeroplane specifies a minimum flight crew of one pilot, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: co-pilot of the aeroplane;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: if qualified as a flight instructor in accordance with section 425.21 of the Personnel Licensing and Training Standards respecting Flight Training, conduct flight instruction; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: exercise private pilot licence — aeroplane privileges until the end of the medical validity period specified for the private pilot licence.

Subsection.Text: Where an applicant meets the requirements specified in the personnel licensing standards in respect of a commercial pilot licence — aeroplane except the night flight time requirements, the Minister shall issue to the applicant a commercial pilot licence — aeroplane endorsed for daylight flying only.
No holder of a commercial pilot licence — aeroplane whose licence is endorsed with a daylight-flying-only restriction shall exercise the privileges set out in paragraphs (1)(a) and (c) by night.
The Minister shall remove the daylight-flying-only restriction if an applicant meets the night flight time requirements of the personnel licensing standards.
Subject to subsection (3), the holder of a commercial pilot licence — helicopter may, by day or night,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: exercise the privileges of a private pilot licence — helicopter;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: while engaged in providing a commercial air service by means of a helicopter of a type in respect of which the licence is endorsed with ratings, act as

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: pilot-in-command of the helicopter, if the minimum flight crew document for the helicopter specifies a minimum flight crew of one pilot, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: co-pilot of the helicopter;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if qualified as a flight instructor in accordance with section 425.21 of the Personnel Licensing and Training Standards respecting Flight Training, conduct flight instruction; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: exercise private pilot licence — helicopter privileges until the end of the medical validity period specified for the private pilot licence.

Subsection.Text: Where an applicant meets the requirements specified in the personnel licensing standards for a commercial pilot licence — helicopter except the night flight time requirements, the Minister shall issue to the applicant a commercial pilot licence — helicopter endorsed for daylight flying only.
No holder of a commercial pilot licence — helicopter whose licence is endorsed with a daylight-flying-only restriction shall exercise the privileges set out in paragraphs (1)(a) and (b) by night.
The Minister shall remove the daylight-flying-only restriction if an applicant meets the night flight time requirements of the personnel licensing standards.
The holder of a multi-crew pilot licence — aeroplane may act as co-pilot of a turbine-powered aeroplane that is operated day or night, under VFR, VFR OTT or IFR, if the aeroplane

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is a transport category aircraft;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is an aeroplane for which a minimum flight crew document has been issued that specifies a minimum flight crew of two pilots;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: is of a type in respect of which the holder’s licence is endorsed with a rating; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: is operated under subpart 4 of Part VI or under Part VII.

Subsection.Text: The holder of a multi-crew pilot licence — aeroplane may act as pilot-in-command of any aircraft for the purpose of the holder’s flight training if the flight training is conducted in accordance with section 401.19.

Heading.TitleText: Division VIII — Airline Transport Pilot Licence

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), the holder of an airline transport pilot licence — aeroplane may exercise the privileges of a private pilot licence — aeroplane and a commercial pilot licence — aeroplane.

The holder of an airline transport pilot licence — aeroplane endorsed with a Group 1 instrument rating may, while engaged in providing a commercial air service by means of an aeroplane of a class and type in respect of which the licence is endorsed with a rating, act as

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: pilot-in-command of the aeroplane, if the minimum flight crew document for that aeroplane specifies a minimum flight crew of two pilots; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: co-pilot of the aeroplane.

Subsection.Text: The holder of an airline transport pilot licence — helicopter may

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: exercise the privileges of a private pilot licence — helicopter and a commercial pilot licence — helicopter; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: while engaged in providing a commercial air service by means of a helicopter of a type for which the licence is endorsed with ratings, act as pilot-in-command or co-pilot of the helicopter.

Subsection.Text: Where an applicant meets the requirements specified in the personnel licensing standards for an airline transport pilot licence — helicopter except the night and instrument flight time requirements, the Minister shall issue to the applicant an airline transport pilot licence — helicopter restricted to aerial work only.
The holder of a flight engineer licence may

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: act as flight engineer in an aircraft of a type for which the licence is endorsed with a rating; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: act as flight engineer in any aircraft for the sole purpose of the holder’s flight training or competency check if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the flight training is conducted under the supervision of a person qualified to give flight engineer training, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the competency check is conducted by a person qualified to conduct the check.

Subsection.Text: A holder of a flight engineer licence who supervises other holders of flight engineer licences may conduct flight training and competency checks in respect of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the issuance of a flight engineer licence;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the endorsement of a flight engineer licence with an aircraft type rating;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the endorsement of a commercial pilot licence — aeroplane or an airline transport pilot licence — aeroplane with a second officer rating; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the endorsement of a licence with an aircraft type rating for second officer privileges, if the licence has a second officer rating.

Section.Text: The Minister shall endorse the following permits and licences with an aeroplane class rating if the applicant for the rating meets the requirements referred to in section 401.06:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: private pilot licence — aeroplane;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: commercial pilot licence — aeroplane;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: airline transport pilot licence — aeroplane; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: pilot permit — recreational — aeroplane.

Section.Text: The holder of a permit or licence that has been endorsed with an aeroplane class rating may exercise the privileges of the permit or licence in the class of aeroplane for which the permit or licence is endorsed.

The Minister shall endorse the permits and licences specified in the personnel licensing standards with a blanket aircraft type rating or an individual type rating if the applicant for the rating meets the requirements referred to in section 401.06.

The holder of a permit or licence that has been endorsed with a blanket aircraft type rating or an individual type rating may exercise the privileges of the permit or licence in the blanket aircraft type or individual aircraft type for which the permit or licence is endorsed.
The Minister shall endorse the following permits and licences with a night rating if the applicant for the rating meets the requirements referred to in section 401.06:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: private pilot licence — aeroplane;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: private pilot licence — helicopter;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: pilot licence — balloon; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: pilot permit — gyroplane.

Section.Text: The holder of a permit or licence that has been endorsed with a night rating may exercise the privileges of the permit or licence by night.
The Minister shall endorse the following licences with a VFR OTT rating if the applicant for the rating meets the requirements referred to in section 401.06:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: private pilot licence — aeroplane;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: private pilot licence — helicopter;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: commercial pilot licence — helicopter; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: airline transport pilot licence — helicopter.

Section.Text: The holder of a licence that has been endorsed with a VFR OTT rating may exercise the privileges of the licence in VFR OTT flight in accordance with section 602.116.

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall endorse the following licences with an instrument rating if the applicant for the rating meets the requirements referred to in section 401.06:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: pilot licence — aeroplane; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: pilot licence — helicopter.

Subsection.Text: Where the Minister has endorsed a licence with an instrument rating, the Minister shall endorse the licence with the group of aircraft in respect of which the privileges may be exercised.

Section.Text: The holder of a licence endorsed with an instrument rating may exercise

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the privileges of the licence under IFR in accordance with Part VI, Subpart 2, Division VII in respect of the group of aircraft endorsed on the licence; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the privileges accorded by a VFR OTT rating.

Section.Text: An instrument rating is valid for the period specified on the licence in accordance with the personnel licensing standards, where the period does not exceed 24 months.

The Minister shall renew an instrument rating in accordance with the personal licensing standards if the holder of the rating continues to meet the requirements referred to in section 401.06 for the endorsement of the rating.
The Minister shall endorse the following licences with a second officer rating if the applicant for the rating meets the requirements referred to in section 401.06:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: commercial pilot licence — aeroplane;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: airline transport pilot licence — aeroplane; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: multi-crew pilot licence — aeroplane.

Subsection.Text: The holder of a second officer rating may

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: act as second officer in any aeroplane of a type to which the rating applies;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: act as second officer in any aeroplane for the sole purpose of the holder’s own flight training or competency check if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the flight training is conducted under the supervision of a person qualified to give second officer training, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the competency check is conducted by a person qualified to conduct the check; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: act as a flight engineer in an aeroplane of a type to which the rating applies.

Subsection.Text: A holder of a second officer rating who supervises other holders of second officer ratings may conduct flight training and competency checks in respect of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the endorsement of a commercial pilot licence — aeroplane or an airline transport pilot licence — aeroplane with a second officer rating; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the endorsement of a licence with an aircraft type rating for second officer privileges, if the holder holds a second officer rating.

Heading.TitleText: Division XVI — Passenger-Carrying Rating — Ultra-Light Aeroplane

Section.Text: The Minister shall endorse a pilot permit — ultra-light aeroplane with a passenger-carrying rating if the applicant for the rating meets the requirements referred to in section 401.06.

The holder of a pilot permit — ultra-light aeroplane endorsed with a passenger-carrying rating may carry one other person on board an ultra-light aeroplane if it has no restrictions against carrying another person.

Heading.TitleText: Division XVII — Flight Instructor Ratings — Aeroplane and Helicopter

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall endorse the following licences with a Class 1, 2, 3 or 4 flight instructor rating — aeroplane if the applicant for the rating meets the requirements referred to in section 401.06:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: commercial pilot licence — aeroplane; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: airline transport pilot licence — aeroplane.

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall endorse the following licences with a Class 1, 2, 3, or 4 flight instructor rating — helicopter if the applicant for the rating meets the requirements referred to in section 401.06:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: commercial pilot licence — helicopter; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: airline transport pilot licence — helicopter.

Section.Text: Subject to paragraph 401.69(e), no holder of a Class 4 flight instructor rating — aeroplane or a Class 4 flight instructor rating — helicopter shall exercise the privileges accorded by that rating unless the holder

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: is conducting the training in accordance with a flight training unit operator certificate; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is under the supervision of a supervising instructor of the flight training unit.

Heading.TitleText: Class 1 or 2 — Supervision of the Holder of a Class 4 Flight Instructor Rating — Aeroplane and Helicopter

Subsection.Text: Where the holder of a Class 1 or Class 2 flight instructor rating — aeroplane supervises the holder of a Class 4 flight instructor rating — aeroplane, the holder of the Class 1 or Class 2 rating shall do so in accordance with the personnel licensing standards.

Where the holder of a Class 1 or Class 2 flight instructor rating — helicopter supervises the holder of a Class 4 flight instructor rating — helicopter, the holder of the Class 1 or Class 2 rating shall do so in accordance with the personnel licensing standards.

Section.Text: The holder of a Class 4 flight instructor rating — aeroplane or a Class 4 flight instructor rating — helicopter shall, in respect of the trainees under the supervision of the holder, keep records in accordance with the personnel licensing standards.

A Class 1, 2, 3 or 4 flight instructor rating — aeroplane or a Class 1, 2, 3 or 4 flight instructor rating — helicopter is valid for the period specified on the licence in accordance with the personnel licensing standards.

The Minister shall renew a flight instructor rating in accordance with the personnel licensing standards if the holder of the rating continues to meet the requirements for the endorsement of the rating referred to in section 401.06.

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall establish, maintain and evaluate a flight test record for each holder of a flight instructor rating — aeroplane, flight instructor rating — helicopter or flight instructor rating — aeroplane — aerobatic in accordance with the personnel licensing standards.

Where the evaluation of a flight test record done pursuant to subsection (1) indicates that follow-up action is required, the Minister shall ensure that the follow-up action is carried out in accordance with the personnel licensing standards.

Heading.TitleText: Division XVIII — Flight Instructor Rating — Aeroplane

Section.Text: The holder of a Class 4 flight instructor rating — aeroplane may

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: conduct dual flight instruction in respect of the issuance of a pilot permit — recreational — aeroplane or pilot licence — aeroplane or the endorsement of a night rating or a VFR OTT rating on a pilot licence — aeroplane;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: authorize a trainee to conduct a solo flight in an aeroplane;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: recommend a trainee for a flight test in respect of the issuance of a pilot permit — recreational — aeroplane or pilot licence — aeroplane;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: recommend a trainee for the endorsement of a night rating or a VFR OTT rating on the trainee’s pilot licence — aeroplane; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: exercise the privileges of a flight instructor rating — ultra-light aeroplane without being under the supervision prescribed in paragraph 401.62(b).

Section.Text: The holder of a Class 3 flight instructor rating — aeroplane may

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: exercise the privileges of a Class 4 flight instructor rating — aeroplane; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: act as chief flight instructor of a flight training unit where there is no other flight instructor for the flight training unit.

Section.Text: The holder of a Class 2 flight instructor rating — aeroplane may

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: exercise the privileges of a Class 3 flight instructor rating — aeroplane;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: supervise the holder of a Class 4 flight instructor rating — aeroplane; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: act as chief flight instructor of a flight training unit.

Section.Text: The holder of a Class 1 flight instructor rating — aeroplane may

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: exercise the privileges of a Class 2 flight instructor rating — aeroplane; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: conduct ground school instruction and flight training in respect of the endorsement of a flight instructor rating — aeroplane.

Heading.TitleText: Division XIX — Flight Instructor Rating — Helicopter

Section.Text: The holder of a Class 4 flight instructor rating — helicopter may

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: conduct dual flight instruction in respect of the issuance of a pilot permit — recreational — helicopter or pilot licence — helicopter or the endorsement of a night rating or a VFR OTT rating on a pilot licence — helicopter;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: authorize a trainee to conduct a solo flight in a helicopter;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
