Paragraph.Text: recommend a trainee for a flight test in respect of the issuance of a pilot permit — recreational — helicopter or pilot licence — helicopter; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: recommend a trainee for the endorsement of a night rating or a VFR OTT rating on the trainee’s pilot licence — helicopter.

Section.Text: The holder of a Class 3 flight instructor rating — helicopter may exercise the privileges of a Class 4 flight instructor rating — helicopter.
The holder of a Class 2 flight instructor rating — helicopter may

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: exercise the privileges of a Class 3 flight instructor rating — helicopter;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: supervise the holder of a Class 4 flight instructor rating — helicopter; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: act as chief flight instructor of a flight training unit.

Section.Text: The holder of a Class 1 flight instructor rating — helicopter may

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: exercise the privileges of a Class 2 flight instructor rating — helicopter; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: conduct ground school instruction and flight training in respect of the endorsement of a licence with a flight instructor rating — helicopter.

Heading.TitleText: Division XX — Flight Instructor Ratings — Glider, Balloon and Gyroplane

Section.Text: The Minister shall, as appropriate, endorse the following permits and licences with a flight instructor rating — glider, balloon or gyroplane if the applicant for the rating meets the requirements referred to in section 401.06:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: pilot permit — gyroplane;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: pilot licence — glider; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: pilot licence — balloon.

Section.Text: The holder of a flight instructor rating — glider may

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: conduct dual flight instruction in respect of the issuance of a pilot licence — glider;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: conduct dual flight instruction in respect of the endorsement of a type rating on a pilot licence — glider;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: authorize a trainee to conduct solo flight in a glider;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: conduct ground school instruction and flight training in respect of the endorsement of a pilot licence — glider with a flight instructor rating — glider;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: conduct a flight test and recommend a trainee for

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the issuance of a pilot licence — glider,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the endorsement of a pilot licence — glider with a type rating, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the endorsement of a pilot licence — glider with a flight instructor rating — glider;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: certify the competency of the holder of a pilot licence — glider to carry passengers in a glider; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: endorse a trainee’s personal log in respect of methods of launch.

Section.Text: The holder of a flight instructor rating — balloon may

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: authorize a trainee to conduct solo flight in a balloon;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: conduct ground school instruction and dual flight instruction in respect of the endorsement of a pilot licence — balloon with a flight instructor rating — balloon;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: conduct a flight test and recommend a trainee for

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the issuance of a pilot licence — balloon, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the endorsement of a pilot licence — balloon with a flight instructor rating — balloon;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: recommend a trainee for the endorsement of a type rating on the trainee’s pilot licence — balloon;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: where the holder’s licence is endorsed with a night rating,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: conduct dual flight instruction in respect of the endorsement of a night rating on a pilot licence — balloon, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: recommend a trainee for the endorsement of a night rating on the trainee’s pilot licence — balloon;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: endorse a trainee’s personal log in respect of methods of inflation; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: conduct dual flight instruction in respect of the issuance of a pilot licence — balloon.

Section.Text: The holder of a flight instructor rating — gyroplane may

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: conduct flight instruction in respect of the issuance of a pilot permit — gyroplane or the endorsement of a type rating on such a permit;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: authorize a trainee to conduct solo flight in a gyroplane;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: recommend a trainee for a flight test in respect of the issuance of a pilot permit — gyroplane;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: recommend a trainee for the endorsement of a type rating on the trainee’s pilot permit — gyroplane;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: where the holder’s licence is endorsed with a night rating,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: conduct flight training in respect of the endorsement of a night rating on a pilot permit — gyroplane, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: recommend a trainee for the endorsement of a night rating on the trainee’s pilot permit — gyroplane; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: where the holder has acquired the experience and qualifications specified in the personnel licensing standards,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: conduct ground school instruction and flight training in respect of the endorsement of a flight instructor rating — gyroplane on a pilot permit — gyroplane,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: recommend a trainee for a flight test for the endorsement of a flight instructor rating — gyroplane on a pilot permit — gyroplane, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: conduct a flight test and recommend a trainee for

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: the issuance of a pilot permit — gyroplane, or

Clause.Label: (B)
Clause.Text: the endorsement of a pilot permit — gyroplane with a flight instructor rating — gyroplane.

Subsection.Text: Flight instructor ratings — glider and balloon are valid for the period specified on the licence in accordance with the personnel licensing standards, if the period does not exceed 37 months.
A flight instructor rating — gyroplane is valid for the period specified on the licence in accordance with the personnel licensing standards, if the period does not exceed 13 months.

Heading.TitleText: Renewal of Flight Instructor Ratings — Glider, Balloon and Gyroplane

Section.Text: The Minister shall renew a flight instructor rating — glider, balloon or gyroplane in accordance with the personnel licensing standards, where the holder of the rating continues to meet the requirements referred to in section 401.06 for the endorsement of the rating.

Heading.TitleText: Division XXI — Flight Instructor Rating — Ultra-Light Aeroplane

Section.Text: The Minister shall endorse a pilot permit — ultra-light aeroplane with a flight instructor rating — ultra-light aeroplane if the applicant for the rating meets the requirements referred to in section 401.06.
The holder of a flight instructor rating — ultra-light aeroplane may

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: operate an ultra-light aeroplane with one other person on board if the holder has not less than 10 hours of flight time as a pilot of an ultra-light aeroplane with the same control configuration and the flight is conducted for the purpose of providing dual flight instruction for

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the issuance of a pilot permit — ultra-light aeroplane,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the endorsement of a pilot permit — ultra-light aeroplane with a passenger-carrying rating, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the endorsement of a pilot permit — ultra-light aeroplane with a flight instructor rating — ultra-light aeroplane;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: authorize the holder of a student pilot permit — ultra-light aeroplane to conduct a solo flight in an ultra-light aeroplane;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: conduct ground school instruction for the endorsement of a pilot permit — ultra-light aeroplane with a flight instructor rating —ultra-light aeroplane;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: certify that an applicant has demonstrated the ability to meet the level of competency specified in the personnel licensing standards for

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the issuance of a pilot permit — ultra-light aeroplane, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the endorsement of a pilot permit — ultra-light aeroplane with a flight instructor rating — ultra-light aeroplane; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: recommend an applicant for a flight test for the issuance of a passenger-carrying rating.

Section.Text: A flight instructor rating — ultra-light aeroplane is valid for the period specified on the licence in accordance with the personnel licensing standards, if the period does not exceed 61 months.

Heading.TitleText: Renewal of Flight Instructor Rating — Ultra-light Aeroplane

Section.Text: The Minister shall renew a flight instructor rating — ultra-light aeroplane in accordance with the personnel licensing standards where the holder of the rating continues to meet the requirements referred to in section 401.06 for the endorsement of the rating.

Heading.TitleText: Division XXII — Flight Instructor Rating — Aeroplane — Aerobatic

Section.Text: The Minister shall endorse a commercial pilot licence — aeroplane or an airline transport pilot licence — aeroplane with a Class 1 or Class 2 flight instructor rating — aeroplane — aerobatic if the applicant for the rating meets the requirements referred to in section 401.06.
The holder of a Class 2 flight instructor rating — aeroplane — aerobatic may

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: conduct flight instruction in the performance of aerobatic manoeuvres; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: certify a licensed pilot’s personal log with respect to competency to perform aerobatic manoeuvres.

Section.Text: The holder of a Class 1 flight instructor rating — aeroplane — aerobatic may

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: exercise the privileges of a Class 2 flight instructor rating — aeroplane — aerobatic;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: provide ground school and flight instruction in respect of the endorsement of a licence with a flight instructor rating — aeroplane — aerobatic; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: recommend a trainee for a flight test in respect of the endorsement of the trainee’s licence with a flight instructor rating — aeroplane — aerobatic.

Heading.TitleText: Division XXIII — Flight Instructor Rating — Glider — Aerobatic

Section.Text: The Minister shall endorse a licence endorsed with a flight instructor rating — glider with a flight instructor rating — glider — aerobatic if the applicant for the flight instructor rating — glider — aerobatic meets the requirements referred to in section 401.06.
The holder of a flight instructor rating — glider — aerobatic may

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: provide, in a glider, flight instruction in the performance of aerobatic manoeuvres;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: provide dual flight instruction to the holder of a flight instructor rating — glider in respect of the endorsement of the holder’s licence with an aerobatic rating — glider; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: recommend the holder of a flight instructor rating — glider for the endorsement of an aerobatic rating — glider on the holder’s licence.

Heading.TitleText: Subpart 2 — Air Traffic Controller Licences and Ratings

Subsection.Text: In this Subpart, proficiency check means an assessment of the operational knowledge, skill and judgement of the holder of, or an applicant for, an air traffic control licence or rating, with respect to the provision of the requisite air traffic services relating to that licence or rating at an operational location.
Any reference in this Subpart to the personnel licensing standards is a reference to the Personnel Licensing and Training Standards respecting Air Traffic Controller Licences and Ratings.

Section.Text: This Subpart applies to persons who hold an air traffic controller licence or who apply for the issuance of such a licence or the endorsement of such a licence with a rating.

Heading.TitleText: Issuance and Endorsement of Air Traffic Controller Licences and Ratings

Subsection.Text: Subject to section 6.71 of the Act and subsections (3) and (4), the Minister shall, on receipt of an application submitted in the form and manner specified in the personnel licensing standards, issue an air traffic controller licence or endorse the applicant’s air traffic controller licence with a rating where the applicant provides documentation to the Minister that establishes

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant’s citizenship; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that the applicant meets the applicable requirements set out in the personnel licensing standards in respect of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: minimum age,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: medical fitness,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: knowledge, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: experience.

Subsection.Text: An application shall also include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: one photograph of the applicant that meets the requirements of subsection 422.03(3) of the personnel licensing standards; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: documentation establishing that the applicant demonstrated, by means of an evaluation, their ability to speak and understand English, or both English and French, at the operational or expert level in accordance with the language proficiency scale set out in the table to subsection 422.03(4) of the personnel licensing standards.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may specify in an air traffic controller licence any condition in respect of the exercise of the privileges of the licence or the privileges of a rating endorsed on the licence, if the condition is required to ensure aviation safety, including any condition in respect of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the training of the licence holder;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the supervision of the licence holder;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the equipment that the licence holder may use; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the operational location at which the licence holder may exercise the privileges of the holder’s air traffic controller licence.

Subsection.Text: Where air traffic control services are provided at an operational location in English only, the Minister shall not endorse an air traffic controller licence with a rating for that operational location unless the applicant has passed an examination that demonstrates that the applicant is sufficiently competent in the use of that language to be able to engage in two-way radiocommunication involving the exchange of safety and control messages.

Where air traffic control services are provided at an operational location in both official languages, the Minister shall not endorse an air traffic controller licence with a rating for that operational location unless the applicant has passed an examination that demonstrates that the applicant is sufficiently competent in the use of both official languages to be able to engage in two-way radiocommunication involving the exchange of safety and control messages.
No person shall act as an air traffic controller or exercise the privileges of an air traffic controller licence unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person holds an air traffic controller licence endorsed with a rating appropriate to the privileges being exercised and with the appropriate operational location;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licence is valid;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the person holds a valid Category 1 or 2 medical certificate; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the person can produce the licence and certificate when exercising those privileges.

Subsection.Text: Paragraph (1)(a) does not apply to a person who, while under supervision, acts as an air traffic controller or exercises the privileges of an air traffic controller licence when undergoing

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: instruction, training or testing in respect of an air traffic controller licence; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: ATC unit familiarization in the course of the person’s employment.

Section.Text: The holder of an air traffic controller licence shall not exercise the privileges of that licence at an air traffic control unit unless the holder has successfully completed a proficiency check within the preceding 12 months.

Subsection.Text: Where an applicant for an air traffic controller licence or for the endorsement of such a licence with a rating meets the applicable requirements set out in the personnel licensing standards, the Minister shall, as appropriate,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: issue a provisional air traffic controller licence to the applicant endorsed with a rating appropriate to the functions to be exercised and with the appropriate operational location; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: endorse the applicant’s air traffic controller licence with a provisional rating for the appropriate operational location.

Subsection.Text: A provisional air traffic controller licence or rating remains in effect until the earlier of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date of issuance of an air traffic controller licence by the Minister pursuant to section 402.03, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a date 90 days after the issuance of the provisional air traffic controller licence or the endorsement of an air traffic controller licence with a provisional rating.

Section.Text: The holder of an air traffic controller licence may, in accordance with Part VIII, the personnel licensing standards and the Canadian Domestic Air Traffic Control Separation Standards, provide or supervise air traffic control services to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: airport traffic at any operational location for which the licence is endorsed with an airport control rating;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: aircraft at any operational location for which the licence is endorsed with a terminal control rating, an area control rating or an oceanic control rating; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: airshow traffic at the operational location in respect of which a special flight operations certificate has been issued by the Minister pursuant to section 603.67.

Heading.TitleText: Validity of Air Traffic Controller Licences

Subsection.Text: An air traffic controller licence that is issued in the form of a booklet label is not valid unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the label is affixed in an aviation document booklet;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the booklet number displayed on the label matches the number of the booklet; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the booklet is signed by the holder.

Subsection.Text: The validity period of an air traffic controller licence that is issued in the form of a booklet label starts on the day on which it is issued and ends on the expiry date of the aviation document booklet in which it is affixed.
The expiry date of an aviation document booklet that has an air traffic controller licence affixed in it is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the first day of the sixty-first month following the day on which the booklet was issued, if the application for the licence included documentation establishing that the holder demonstrated an expert level ability during their language proficiency evaluation; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the first day of the sixty-first month following the day on which the holder’s language proficiency evaluation was conducted, if the application for the licence included documentation establishing that the holder demonstrated an operational level ability during the evaluation.

Subsection.Text: An air traffic controller licence, other than a provisional air traffic controller licence, that was not issued in the form of a booklet label is valid until June 30, 2010.

Section.Text: If the documentation included with an application for an air traffic controller licence that was issued in the form of a booklet label establishes that the holder demonstrated an operational level ability during their language proficiency evaluation, the holder shall, for the purposes of renewing the licence, be evaluated again within the six months preceding the expiry date of the aviation document booklet in which it is affixed.
The manager of an ATC unit shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: maintain, on a form provided by the Minister, a training record for each person undergoing training at the ATC unit for the purpose of obtaining a rating or operational location endorsement in respect of the ATC unit;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: enter the licence number of the training officer or supervisor in the training record and certify that any information entered in the record is correct by signing and dating the entry and any amendment thereto;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: at the request of any person who is undergoing or has undergone training at the ATC unit, provide a copy of the person’s training record to the person; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: at the request of the Minister, provide the Minister with a copy of the training record of any person who is undergoing or has undergone training at the ATC unit and who holds an air traffic controller licence.

Heading.TitleText: Subpart 3 — Aircraft Maintenance Engineer Licences and Ratings

Section.Text: This Subpart applies to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: holders of an aircraft maintenance engineer (AME) licence and applicants for the issuance or renewal of such a licence; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: approved training organizations that provide aircraft maintenance training courses, and persons applying to become approved training organizations.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2), no person shall exercise the privileges of an aircraft maintenance engineer (AME) licence unless the person

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: holds an AME licence issued pursuant to this Subpart;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: exercises the privileges in accordance with the ratings and any limitations endorsed on the licence; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: exercises the privileges in accordance with Part V.

Subsection.Text: A person who does not meet the conditions specified in subsection (1) may sign a maintenance release if the person holds a restricted certification authority issued pursuant to Part V.

Heading.TitleText: Issuance and Endorsement of AME Licence

Section.Text: Subject to section 6.71 of the Act, the Minister shall, on receipt of an application submitted in the form and manner specified in Chapter 566 of the Airworthiness Manual, issue an aircraft maintenance engineer (AME) licence to the applicant or endorse the applicant’s AME licence with a rating, where the applicant provides documentation to the Minister that establishes

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant’s citizenship; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: that the applicant meets the requirements set out in Chapter 566 of the Airworthiness Manual in respect of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: minimum age,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: training,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: knowledge,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: experience, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: skill.

Section.Text: Subject to section 403.05, an aircraft maintenance engineer (AME) licence is valid for the period specified in the licence.

Subsection.Text: No holder of an aircraft maintenance engineer (AME) licence shall exercise the privileges of the licence unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the licence was issued within the preceding 24 months; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the holder of the licence has, for at least six months within the preceding 24 months,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: performed aircraft maintenance,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: supervised the performance of aircraft maintenance,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: supervised in an executive capacity the performance of aircraft maintenance, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: served as an aviation maintenance instructor or supervised another aviation maintenance instructor in an aircraft maintenance training course provided by an approved training organization.

Subsection.Text: The holder of an AME licence who is not in compliance with subsection (1) shall regain currency in accordance with the standards set out in Chapter 566 of the Airworthiness Manual prior to exercising the privileges of the licence.
No person shall provide aircraft maintenance training courses as an approved training organization unless the person holds an approved training organization certificate.
The Minister shall issue an approved training organization certificate to a person who

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: makes an application for a certificate; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: meets the standards respecting training courses, facilities and instructors that are applicable to the training to be provided, as set out in Chapter 566 of the Airworthiness Manual.

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall approve a policy manual or a training control manual and any amendments to that manual if the manual and amendments meet the requirements of Standard 566 — Aircraft Maintenance Engineer Licensing and Training.

In this Subpart, CAME means a Civil Aviation Medical Examiner appointed by the Minister to conduct medical examinations of applicants for the issuance or renewal of medical certificates pursuant to subsection 404.04(1).
Any reference in this Subpart to the personnel licensing standards is a reference to the Personnel Licensing and Training Standards respecting Medical Requirements.

Section.Text: This Subpart applies to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: persons who hold or who apply for the issuance or renewal of a medical certificate for the purpose of exercising the privileges of a permit, licence or rating referred to in section 404.10; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the physicians referred to in section 404.16.

Heading.TitleText: Requirement to Hold a Medical Certificate

Subsection.Text: No person shall exercise or attempt to exercise the privileges of a permit, licence or rating unless the person holds a valid medical certificate of a category that is appropriate for that permit, licence or rating, as specified in section 404.10.
A medical certificate that is issued in the form of a booklet label is not valid unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the label is affixed in an aviation document booklet;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the booklet number displayed on the label matches the number of the booklet; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the booklet is signed by the holder.

Heading.TitleText: Issuance, Renewal, Validity Period and Extension of a Medical Certificate

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (2) and subsection 404.05(1), the Minister shall issue or renew a medical certificate on receipt of an application therefor if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: where the applicant is applying for a medical certificate in connection with an application for a student pilot permit-aeroplane, pilot permit — recreational, pilot or student pilot permit — ultra-light aeroplane, a pilot licence — glider or student pilot permit — glider, the applicant has completed and submitted a medical declaration, in accordance with the personnel licensing standards, that attests to the fact that the applicant is medically fit to exercise the privileges of the permit or licence that is applied for; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in any case not referred to in paragraph (a), it is established, by means of a medical examination conducted by a physician referred to in section 404.16, that the applicant meets the medical fitness requirements specified in the personnel licensing standards.

Subsection.Text: A medical certificate is also renewed if it is signed, dated and stamped in accordance with paragraph 404.18(a).
The Minister

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: may request an applicant for the issuance or renewal of a medical certificate to undergo, before a specified date, any medical tests or examinations that are necessary to determine whether the applicant meets the medical fitness requirements specified in the personnel licensing standards;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: shall not issue or renew a medical certificate until the applicant has undergone all of the tests and examinations requested by the Minister pursuant to paragraph (a); and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: may suspend, or refuse to issue or renew, the applicant’s medical certificate if the applicant fails to comply with the request referred to in paragraph (a) before the specified date.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: request the holder of a medical certificate to undergo, before a specified date, any medical tests or examinations or provide any additional medical information, as necessary to determine whether the holder continues to meet the medical fitness requirements specified in the personnel licensing standards; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: suspend, or refuse to renew, the holder’s medical certificate if the holder fails to comply with the request referred to in paragraph (a) before the specified date.

Subsection.Text: A medical certificate is subject to any restrictions or limitations that have been endorsed on the certificate in accordance with subsection 404.05(2).

A medical certificate is valid starting on the day on which the applicant signs the medical declaration submitted for the issuance or renewal of the certificate or on the day on which the medical examination for the issuance or renewal of the certificate is conducted until the earliest of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the end of the validity period set out in the table to subsection (6) for the certificate,

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the end of any shorter validity period endorsed on the certificate by the Minister, and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the day on which a new medical certificate is issued to the holder.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsection (9), the validity period of a medical certificate for a permit, licence or rating that is set out in column 1 of the table to this subsection is set out in column 2 if the holder of the permit, licence or rating is under 40 years of age and in column 3 if the holder of the permit, licence or rating is 40 years of age or older.

The validity period of a medical certificate for a commercial pilot licence, a multi-crew pilot licence — aeroplane and an airline transport pilot licence, if the holder of the licence is acting as a flight crew member for hire or reward, is 12 months.
However, the validity period of a medical certificate referred to in subsection (6.1) is reduced to 6 months if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the holder of the licence is 40 years of age or older and is conducting a single-pilot operation with passengers on board; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the holder of the licence is 60 years of age or older.

Subsection.Text: The holder of a commercial pilot licence or an airline transport pilot licence may exercise the privileges of a private pilot licence until the end of the applicable validity period for the private pilot licence specified in subsection (6).
The end of the validity period of a medical certificate that is issued or renewed under subsection (1) is calculated from the first day of the month following

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the day on which the applicant signs the medical declaration submitted for the issuance or renewal of the certificate; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the day on which the medical examination for the issuance or renewal of the certificate is conducted.

Subsection.Text: The end of the validity period of a medical certificate that is renewed in accordance with subsection (1.1) is calculated from

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the day on which the preceding validity period ends if the medical examination for the renewal of the certificate is conducted within 90 days before the end of that validity period; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the first day of the month following the day on which the medical examination for the renewal of the certificate is conducted if the examination is conducted more than 90 days before the end of the preceding validity period.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may endorse a shorter validity period on a medical certificate if a physician referred to in section 404.16 recommends the shorter validity period in their medical report.

Despite subsection (6), the Minister shall extend the validity period of a medical certificate for a period of not more than 60 days beginning on the day on which the certificate would otherwise expire, if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the application for extension of the certificate is made while the certificate is still valid; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant demonstrates that there has been no reasonable opportunity to undergo a medical examination within the 90 days before the day on which the certificate would otherwise expire.

Heading.TitleText: Medical Standards Flexibility — Limitations and Restrictions

Subsection.Text: The Minister may, in accordance with the personnel licensing standards, issue a medical certificate to an applicant who does not meet the requirements referred to in subsection 404.04(1) where it is in the public interest and is not likely to affect aviation safety.
Where the Minister issues a medical certificate under subsection (1), the Minister shall endorse the certificate with any limitation or restriction that is necessary to ensure aviation safety.
The Minister may amend or remove any limitation or restriction referred to in subsection (2) when it is no longer required to ensure aviation safety.
The Minister may suspend or cancel a medical certificate if the applicant fails to comply with any limitation or restriction referred to in subsection (2).

Before issuing a medical certificate under subsection (1), the Minister may require an applicant to undergo any practical test in respect of the functions of a flight crew member or air traffic controller, as appropriate, or any medical examination that is necessary to determine whether the applicant meets the medical fitness requirements specified in the personnel licensing standards.
For the purposes of a practical test in respect of the functions of a flight crew member, the Minister may designate as a testing officer any person who holds

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a flight crew licence endorsed with a flight instructor rating that is valid for the category of aircraft to be used during the practical test; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a flight crew licence and has the qualifications required to conduct the practical test.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of a practical test in respect of the functions of an air traffic controller, the test shall be conducted in an actual operational environment under the supervision of an Air Traffic Services manager, a regional aviation medical officer, an aviation medical officer or a CAME, in accordance with the procedures set out in the personnel licensing standards.
Subject to subsection (3), no holder of a permit, licence or rating shall exercise the privileges of the permit, licence or rating if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: one of the following circumstances exists and could impair the holder’s ability to exercise those privileges safely:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the holder suffers from an illness, injury or disability,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the holder is taking a drug, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the holder is receiving medical treatment;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the holder has been involved in an aircraft accident that is wholly or partially the result of any of the circumstances referred to in paragraph (a);

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the holder has entered the thirtieth week of pregnancy, unless the medical certificate is issued in connection with an air traffic controller licence, in which case the holder may exercise the privileges of the permit, licence or rating until the onset of labour; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the holder has given birth in the preceding six weeks.

Subsection.Text: No holder of a permit, licence or rating who is referred to in paragraph (1)(b), (c) or (d) shall exercise the privileges of the permit, licence or rating unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the holder has undergone a medical examination referred to in section 404.18; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the medical examiner has indicated on the holder’s medical certificate that the holder is medically fit to exercise the privileges of the permit, licence or rating.

Subsection.Text: The Minister may, in writing, authorize the holder of a medical certificate to exercise, under the circumstances described in paragraph (1)(a) or (d), the privileges of the permit, licence or rating to which the medical certificate relates if such authorization is in the public interest and is not likely to affect aviation safety.

Heading.TitleText: Medical Certificate Requirements for Personnel Licences

Subsection.Text: A Category 1 medical certificate is required for the following licences:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: commercial pilot licence — aeroplane or helicopter;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: multi-crew pilot licence — aeroplane;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: airline transport pilot licence — aeroplane or helicopter; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: flight engineer licence.

Subsection.Text: A Category 1 or 2 medical certificate is required for an air traffic controller licence.
A Category 1 or 3 medical certificate is required for the following permits, licences and ratings:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: student pilot permit — helicopter;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: pilot permit — gyroplane;

Paragraph.Label: (b.1)
Paragraph.Text: student pilot permit — gyroplane or balloon;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: private pilot licence — aeroplane or helicopter;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: pilot licence — balloon;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: flight instructor rating — glider; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: flight instructor rating — ultra-light aeroplane.

Subsection.Text: A Category 1, 3 or 4 medical certificate is required for the following permits and licences:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: student pilot permit - aeroplane;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: pilot permit — recreational;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: student pilot permit or pilot permit — ultra-light aeroplane;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: student pilot permit — glider; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: pilot licence — glider.

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall assess any medical reports submitted pursuant to paragraph 404.17(b) to determine whether an applicant for the issuance or renewal of a medical certificate meets the medical fitness requirements set out in the personnel licensing standards that are necessary for the issuance or renewal of the medical certificate.
The Minister shall, by personal service or by registered mail sent to the applicant at the latest known address of the applicant, immediately

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: notify the applicant of the result of an assessment, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an application for the renewal of a medical certificate, inform the applicant that the Minister will, no earlier than 30 days after the date that the applicant receives the notification, make a decision pursuant to subsection 7.1(1) of the Act, based on the result of the assessment.

Subsection.Text: An applicant for the renewal of a medical certificate who is assessed by the Minister as not meeting the requirements referred to in subsection 404.11(1) may, within 30 days after the date that the applicant receives the notification referred to in subsection 404.11(2),

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: request the Minister to reconsider the assessment; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: submit additional information to the Minister regarding the medical fitness of the applicant in support of the request.

Subsection.Text: Where the Minister is requested to reconsider an assessment pursuant to subsection (1), the Minister shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: take into consideration any additional information regarding the medical fitness of the applicant; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: immediately notify the applicant in writing of the result of the reconsideration of the assessment.

Section.Text: No physician shall conduct a medical examination of an applicant for the issuance or renewal of a medical certificate unless the physician conducts the medical examination in the region in which the physician is licensed to practise and

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the physician is appointed by the Minister as a CAME;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: where the applicant is a regular member of the Canadian Forces or an air cadet, the physician is a Canadian Forces flight surgeon; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: where the applicant resides or is examined in a contracting state other than Canada, the physician is authorized by the licensing authority of the contracting state to conduct such examinations.

Section.Text: Where a physician referred to in paragraph 404.16(a) or (b) conducts a medical examination of an applicant for the issuance or renewal of a medical certificate, the physician shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: conduct the medical examination in accordance with the procedures set out in the personnel licensing standards; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: submit a medical report to the Minister that specifies the results of the medical examination and contains, if warranted by those results, the physician’s recommendation that the medical certificate be restricted to a validity period that is shorter than the validity period set out in the table to subsection 404.04(6) for the certificate.

Heading.TitleText: Examination for Renewal of a Medical Certificate or for Permission to Continue to Exercise the Privileges of a Permit, Licence or Rating

Section.Text: When the holder of a medical certificate undergoes a medical examination by a physician referred to in paragraph 404.16(a) or (b) for the purpose of renewing his or her certificate or obtaining permission to continue to exercise the privileges of his or her permit, licence or rating, the physician shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: sign and date the medical certificate and stamp it with his or her official stamp indicating that the holder is “fit” and return the medical certificate to the holder; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: advise the holder that he or she is “unfit” and return the medical certificate to the holder.

Subsection.Text: In this Subpart, Personnel Licensing and Training Standards respecting Flight Training means a publication concerning flight training.
Any reference in this Subpart to the personnel licensing standards is a reference to the Personnel Licensing and Training Standards respecting Flight Training.

Section.Text: This Subpart applies in respect of the conduct of flight training using an aeroplane, helicopter, glider, balloon, gyroplane or ultra-light aeroplane.
No person shall conduct flight training unless the flight training program is in accordance with the requirements of Subpart 1 in respect of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the initial issuance of a permit, licence or rating;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the renewal of a rating; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a flight review.

Section.Text: Where a syllabus for a flight training program is not set out in the Personnel Licensing and Training Standards respecting Flight Crew Permits, Licences and Ratings, the Minister shall approve a proposed syllabus for a flight training program if the program meets those standards.

A person who conducts flight training using an aeroplane or helicopter shall provide to each trainee, at the time of commencing a flight training program referred to in section 405.11, a flight training program outline that meets the personnel licensing standards.

Flight training that is conducted using an aeroplane or helicopter shall be conducted in accordance with the applicable flight instructor guide and flight training manual or equivalent document and the applicable training manual on human factors.

Subsection.Text: No person shall conduct flight training or a flight review unless the person is qualified as a flight instructor in accordance with the personnel licensing standards.

In cases where a qualified gyroplane flight instructor is not available, a person may conduct the gyroplane training that has to be acquired to satisfy the experience requirement for the issuance of a pilot permit — gyroplane if the person obtains a written authorization from the Minister to conduct the training in accordance with subsection 421.84(4) of the personnel licensing standards.

A person who conducts flight training toward the issuance of an aircraft type rating may, in the case of training for a holder of a pilot permit — gyroplane, obtain a written authorization from the Minister to conduct the flight training in accordance with paragraph 425.21(7)(c) of the personnel licensing standards if the authorization is in the public interest and is not likely to affect aviation safety.

A person who conducts flight training toward the issuance of an aircraft type rating may, in the case of training for a holder of a student pilot permit — gyroplane, obtain a written authorization from the Minister to conduct the flight training in accordance with paragraph 425.21(7)(d) of the personnel licensing standards if the authorization is in the public interest and is not likely to affect aviation safety.

A person who conducts ground school instruction toward the issuance of a flight instructor rating may obtain a written authorization from the Minister to conduct the ground school instruction in accordance with the personnel licensing standards.

Section.Text: No person shall conduct flight training in an aircraft unless the person is familiar with the flight characteristics, operating limitations and operational performance data specified in the aircraft flight manual or equivalent document.
No person shall operate a training aircraft unless the aircraft meets the personnel licensing standards.
No person shall operate a training aircraft at an aerodrome unless the aerodrome is suitable for the aircraft

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: to be safely operated within the operating limitations and operational performance data specified in the aircraft flight manual or equivalent document

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: allowing for the actual aircraft weight and existing air temperature and wind conditions,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: with the power plant operation and landing gear and flap operation, if applicable, recommended by the manufacturer, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: with smooth transition from take-off to the best rate-of-climb speed using normal piloting skills; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a helicopter, to carry out normal transitions from the hover to forward flight and from forward flight to the hover.

Section.Text: No person shall commence a training flight unless the trainee has received from the flight instructor

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a pre-flight briefing; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: where new flight exercises are to be conducted during the flight, preparatory ground instruction.

Section.Text: Before the commencement of a training flight, the flight instructor who will conduct or supervise the training shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: authorize the training flight; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: receive an acknowledgement of that authorization from the trainee.

Subsection.Text: A person who conducts flight training for the issuance of a private pilot licence, a commercial pilot licence or a flight instructor rating — aeroplane or helicopter shall, for each trainee, maintain a pilot training record that meets the personnel licensing standards.
On request from a trainee receiving training for the purposes referred to in subsection (1), the person responsible for maintaining the trainee’s pilot training record shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: certify the accuracy of the entries; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: provide the trainee with the record.

Subsection.Text: When a trainee has completed flight training, including all of the tests and written examinations required pursuant to Subpart 1, the person who conducted the flight training shall forward the trainee’s pilot training record to the Minister.
In this Subpart, Personnel Licensing and Training Standards respecting Flight Training Units means a publication concerning flight training units.
Any reference in this Subpart to the personnel licensing standards is a reference to Standard 426 – Personnel Licensing and Training – Flight Training Units.

Section.Text: This Subpart applies in respect of the operation of an aeroplane, helicopter, glider, balloon, gyroplane or ultra-light aeroplane in a flight training service toward obtaining any of the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: for aeroplanes,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a private pilot licence,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a commercial pilot licence,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a landplane or seaplane rating,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a flight instructor rating,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: a flight instructor rating — aerobatic,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: an instrument rating,

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: a multi-engine class rating,

Subparagraph.Label: (viii)
Subparagraph.Text: a night rating,

Subparagraph.Label: (ix)
Subparagraph.Text: a VFR over-the-top rating,

Subparagraph.Label: (x)
Subparagraph.Text: a pilot permit — recreational, or

Subparagraph.Label: (xi)
Subparagraph.Text: experience in aerobatic manoeuvres;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: for helicopters,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a private pilot licence,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a commercial pilot licence,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a flight instructor rating,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: an instrument rating,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: a night rating,

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: a VFR over-the-top rating, or

Subparagraph.Label: (vii)
Subparagraph.Text: a pilot permit — recreational;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: for gliders,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a pilot licence,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a flight instructor rating,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a flight instructor rating — aerobatic, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: experience in aerobatic manoeuvres;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: for balloons,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a pilot licence,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a flight instructor rating, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a night rating;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: for gyroplanes,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a pilot permit,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a flight instructor rating, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a night rating; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: for ultra-light aeroplanes,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a pilot permit,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a flight instructor rating, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a passenger-carrying rating.

Heading.TitleText: Requirement to Hold a Flight Training Unit Operator Certificate

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), no person shall operate a flight training service in Canada using an aeroplane or helicopter in Canada unless the person holds a flight training unit operator certificate that authorizes the person to operate the service and complies with the conditions and operations specifications set out in the certificate.
A person who does not hold a flight training unit operator certificate may operate a flight training service if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person holds a private operator registration document or an air operator certificate, the aircraft used for training — in the case of the holder of an air operator certificate — is specified in the air operator certificate, and the training is other than toward obtaining a pilot permit — recreational, a private pilot licence, a commercial pilot licence or a flight instructor rating; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the trainee is

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the owner, or a member of the family of the owner, of the aircraft used for training,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a director of a corporation that owns the aircraft used for training, and the training is other than toward obtaining a pilot permit — recreational or a private pilot licence, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: using an aircraft that has been obtained from a person who is at arm’s length from the flight instructor, and the training is other than toward obtaining a pilot permit — recreational or a private pilot licence.

Subsection.Text: In the case of flight training conducted under subparagraph (2)(b)(iii), the flight instructor shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: notify the Minister in writing of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of the person to receive the training,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the registration of the aircraft to be used,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the type of training to be conducted,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the location of the training operations, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and licence number of the flight instructor; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: provide the information to the Minister

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: prior to commencing training operations,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: within 10 working days after any change to the information, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: when the training is discontinued.

Heading.TitleText: Eligibility to Hold a Flight Training Unit Operator Certificate

Section.Text: A person is eligible to hold a flight training unit operator certificate if the person is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a Canadian; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a citizen, permanent resident or corporation of the United States of America or Mexico.

Subsection.Text: No person shall operate a flight training unit using a glider, balloon, gyroplane or ultra-light aeroplane in Canada unless the person notifies the Minister in writing of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the legal name, trade name and address of the operator of the flight training unit;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the base of operations;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the category of aircraft;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the type of flight training to be conducted; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the flight instructor who will be responsible for operational control of the flight training operations.

Subsection.Text: The information referred to in subsection (1) shall be provided to the Minister by the flight training unit

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: prior to commencing flight training operations;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: within 10 working days after any change in the information; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: upon the service being discontinued.

Heading.TitleText: Issuance or Amendment of a Flight Training Unit Operator Certificate

Subsection.Text: Subject to section 6.71 of the Act, the Minister shall, on receipt of an application submitted in the form and manner specified in the personnel licensing standards, issue or amend a flight training unit operator certificate where the applicant demonstrates to the Minister the ability to

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: maintain an adequate organizational structure;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: maintain operational control;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: comply with maintenance requirements;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: meet the personnel licensing standards; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: conduct the operation safely.

Subsection.Text: For the purposes of subsection (1), an applicant shall have

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a management organization capable of exercising operational control;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: managerial personnel who are employed on a full-time basis and who perform the duties related to the following positions:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: chief flight instructor,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: flight instructor,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: ground instructor, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: if the applicant does not hold an approved maintenance organization certificate, a maintenance manager;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: aircraft that are properly equipped for and flight crew members who are qualified for the type of flight training that is being conducted;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an operational control system that meets the requirements of section 406.50;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a training program that meets the requirements of this Subpart;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: legal custody and control of at least one aircraft or, in the case of an applicant for a flight training unit operator certificate who conducts an integrated course, one aircraft of each class of aircraft that is to be operated;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an applicant for a flight training unit operator certificate who conducts an integrated course or who operates a sub-base, a flight training operations manual that meets the requirements of section 406.61 and, in the case of an applicant who conducts an integrated course, a training manual that meets the requirements of section 406.62; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: a maintenance control system approved under this Subpart.

Heading.TitleText: Contents of a Flight Training Unit Operator Certificate

Section.Text: A flight training unit operator certificate shall contain the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the legal name, trade name and address of the flight training unit;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the number of the certificate;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the effective date of certification;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the date of issue of the certificate;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the general conditions identified in section 406.13;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: specific conditions with respect to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the main base and, if applicable, for flight training units conducting training in accordance with a flight training operations manual, sub-bases,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the class and type of aeroplane or the type of helicopter, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the type of training authorized; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: where the flight training unit complies with the personnel licensing standards, operations specifications with respect to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of a flight training unit that operates aeroplanes or helicopters, the conduct of flight training operations on a temporary basis at a satellite base, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: any other condition pertaining to the operation that the Minister deems necessary for aviation safety.

Heading.TitleText: General Conditions of a Flight Training Unit Operator Certificate

Section.Text: A flight training unit operator certificate shall contain the following general conditions:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the flight training unit shall maintain the organizational structure referred to in paragraph 406.11(1)(a);

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the flight training unit shall have the personnel referred to in the personnel licensing standards;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the flight training unit shall have aircraft that are properly equipped for the geographic area of operation and the type of authorized training;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the flight training unit shall maintain its aircraft in accordance with the maintenance requirements of Parts V and VI and Division IV of this Subpart;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the flight training unit shall conduct flight training in accordance with the provisions of Subpart 5 and Division V of this Subpart and, if the flight training unit conducts an integrated course or operates a sub-base, it shall also conduct flight training in accordance with the flight training operations manual;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the flight training unit shall, when required to establish and maintain a training manual in accordance with section 406.62, conduct training in accordance with that training manual; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the flight training unit shall notify the Minister of any change in its legal name, trade name, base of operations or managerial personnel within 10 working days after the change.

Section.Text: A flight training unit that conducts an integrated course shall establish and maintain a quality assurance program that meets the requirements of section 426.14 of the personnel licensing standards in order to ensure that the flight training unit continues to comply with the conditions and specifications in the flight training unit operator certificate.

Heading.TitleText: Duties of Certificate Holder in Respect of Maintenance

Subsection.Text: The holder of an operator certificate issued in respect of a flight training unit that operates an aeroplane or a helicopter shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: appoint a person responsible for the maintenance control system;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: subject to subsection (4), ensure that the person responsible for the maintenance control system has achieved a grade of 70% or more in an open-book examination that demonstrates knowledge of the provisions of the Canadian Aviation Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that the person responsible for the maintenance control system demonstrates to the Minister knowledge of the topics set out in subsection 426.36(1) of the personnel licensing standards within 30 days after their appointment;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that the person responsible for the maintenance control system performs the duties referred to in subsections 406.36(1) and 406.47(2) and (3);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: provide the person responsible for the maintenance control system with the financial and human resources necessary to ensure that the holder of the flight training unit operator certificate meets the requirements of these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: authorize the person responsible for the maintenance control system to remove aircraft from operation if the removal is justified because of non-compliance with the requirements of these Regulations or because of a risk to aviation safety or the safety of the public; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that corrective actions are taken in respect of any findings resulting from a quality assurance program established under section 406.47.

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall conduct an interview with the person appointed under paragraph (1)(a) to assess their knowledge of the topics referred to in paragraph (1)(c).

The Minister shall notify the person appointed under paragraph (1)(a) of the results of the assessment and identify any deficiencies in their knowledge of the topics within ten days after the interview.
The knowledge requirement set out in paragraph (1)(b) does not apply in respect of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a person responsible for the maintenance control system who held that position on January 1, 1997; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the holder of an aircraft maintenance engineer (AME) licence.

Subsection.Text: The holder of a flight training unit operator certificate shall ensure that no person is appointed to be responsible for the maintenance control system or remains responsible for the system if, at the time of their appointment or during their tenure, they have a record of conviction for

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an offence under section 7.3 of the Act; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: two or more offences under any of sections 605.84 to 605.86 not arising from a single occurrence.

Subsection.Text: Subject to subsections (3) and (4), a flight training unit shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: appoint a chief flight instructor; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that the person appointed as chief flight instructor meets the requirements set out in section 406.22.

Subsection.Text: A flight training unit shall inform the Minister within 10 working days after

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the appointment of a chief flight instructor; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any change in the appointment of a chief flight instructor.

Subsection.Text: With the authorization of the Minister, a flight training unit may, for a period of up to 60 days, continue flight training operations without a chief flight instructor if the flight training unit complies with the personnel licensing standards.

With the authorization of the Minister, a flight training unit may, for a period of up to six months, continue flight training operations with a chief flight instructor who is subject to a prohibition regarding the exercise of the privileges of a permit, licence or rating pursuant to section 404.06, if the flight training unit complies with the personnel licensing standards.

Section.Text: No person shall act as a chief flight instructor unless the person

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has the qualifications required for the position, as set out in the personnel licensing standards; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: acknowledges in writing that the person knows, accepts and will carry out the responsibilities of the position, as set out in the personnel licensing standards.

Heading.TitleText: Requirements for Assistant Chief Flight Instructor

Section.Text: No flight training unit shall appoint a person as an assistant chief flight instructor and no person shall act as an assistant chief flight instructor unless the person

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has the qualifications required for the position, as set out in the personnel licensing standards; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: acknowledges in writing that the person knows, accepts and will carry out the responsibilities of the position, as assigned in writing by the chief flight instructor.

Section.Text: A flight training unit conducting an integrated course in accordance with Division VIII of this Subpart shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: appoint a check instructor; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that the person appointed as check instructor meets the requirements set out in section 406.22.3.

Section.Text: No person shall act as a check instructor unless the person is a chief flight instructor or

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has the qualifications required for the position, as set out in the personnel licensing standards; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: acknowledges in writing that the person knows, accepts and will carry out the responsibilities of the position, as assigned in writing by the chief flight instructor.

Section.Text: No flight training unit shall appoint a person as a flight instructor unless the person is qualified in accordance with section 405.21.

No flight training unit shall appoint a person as a ground instructor and no person shall act as a ground instructor unless the person holds a flight instructor rating in the appropriate category or meets the personnel licensing standards.

A flight training unit shall, at its main base or sub-base, as applicable, establish, maintain and retain for at least two years after an entry is made, for each ground instructor, each flight instructor and every other member of its operational personnel, a record that meets the personnel licensing standards.

No flight training unit shall assign a person to conduct flight training in an aircraft unless the person is familiar with the flight characteristics, operating limitations and operational performance data specified in the aircraft flight manual or equivalent document.
No flight training unit that is a person described in paragraph 406.04(a) shall operate an aircraft in a flight training service in Canada unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the aircraft is registered in Canada under Division II of Subpart 2 of Part II or in another contracting state;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: where the aircraft is registered in another contracting state, the Minister has authorized its operation; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an aircraft other than an ultra-light aeroplane, the aircraft type is approved for operation in Canada.

Section.Text: No flight training unit shall operate an aircraft in a flight training service unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a flight training unit that operates an aeroplane or a helicopter, a certificate of airworthiness that meets the requirements of Article 31 of the Convention has been issued for the aircraft pursuant to section 507.02;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a flight training unit that operates a glider, a balloon or a gyroplane, a flight authority has been issued for the aircraft pursuant to Subpart 7 of Part V; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the aircraft meets the requirements of section 405.23.

Heading.TitleText: Safety Belt and Shoulder Harness Requirements

Section.Text: No flight training unit shall operate an aeroplane or a helicopter unless each front seat, or each seat occupied by a trainee or flight instructor, is equipped with a safety belt that includes a shoulder harness.

For the purpose of establishing safe aircraft operating procedures, a flight training unit that operates an aeroplane or a helicopter shall establish and make readily available to each flight crew member on board the aircraft the checklist referred to in section 602.60 for each aircraft type that it operates.
A flight training unit that operates an aeroplane or a helicopter shall establish and comply with a maintenance control system that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: consists of policies and procedures regarding the maintenance of aircraft operated by the flight training unit;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: meets the requirements of this Subpart; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: is described in the flight training unit’s maintenance control manual (MCM).

Heading.TitleText: Person Responsible for Maintenance Control System

Subsection.Text: The person responsible for the maintenance control system appointed under paragraph 406.19(1)(a) shall, where a finding resulting from a quality assurance program established under section 406.47 is reported to them,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: determine what, if any, corrective actions are required and carry out those actions;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: keep a record of any determination made under paragraph (a) and the reason for it;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if management functions have been assigned to another person under subsection (2) or (3), communicate any determination regarding a corrective action to that person; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: notify the accountable executive of any systemic deficiency and of the corrective action taken.

Subsection.Text: The person responsible for the maintenance control system may assign the management functions for the entire quality assurance program established under section 406.47, including the authority to remove aircraft from operation under paragraph 406.19(1)(f), to another person if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: that person meets the requirements set out in paragraphs 406.19(1)(b) and (c) and subsection 406.19(5); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the assignment and its scope are described in the maintenance control manual (MCM) of a flight training unit that operates an aeroplane or a helicopter.

Subsection.Text: The person responsible for the maintenance control system may assign the management functions for specific maintenance control activities, including the authority to remove aircraft from operation under paragraph 406.19(1)(f), to another person if the assignment and its scope are described in the MCM of a flight training unit that operates an aeroplane or a helicopter.
The responsibility of the person responsible for the maintenance control system is not affected by the assignment to another person of management functions under subsection (2) or (3).

If a flight training unit that operates an aeroplane or a helicopter is also the holder of an approved maintenance organization (AMO) certificate issued under section 573.02, the person responsible for the maintenance control system at the flight training unit shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be the person responsible for maintenance at the AMO appointed under section 573.03; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: meet the requirements referred to in paragraph 406.19(1)(b), subsection 406.19(5) and paragraph 573.03(1)(c).

Section.Text: A flight training unit shall provide the person who is responsible for its maintenance control system with the staff, facilities, technical and regulatory data, supplies and spare parts referred to in the personnel licensing standards that are necessary for compliance with this Subpart.

Subsection.Text: A flight training unit that operates an aeroplane or a helicopter shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: establish and submit to the Minister for approval a maintenance control manual that contains the information set out in the personnel licensing standards;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: except where otherwise authorized by the Minister in writing where it is demonstrated that the granting of the authorization will not jeopardize the safety of the service, authorize the use of its maintenance control manual and comply with the policies and procedures contained therein;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: take steps to ensure that a copy of its maintenance control manual, or of the relevant portions of its maintenance control manual, is made available to each person who performs or certifies a function that is dealt with in the maintenance control manual or in any manual that is incorporated in the maintenance control manual pursuant to subsection (2);

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: submit amendments to its maintenance control manual to the Minister for approval when instructed to do so by the Minister, where

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the maintenance control manual does not meet the requirements of this Subpart, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the maintenance control manual contains policies or procedures, or a lack thereof, such that the flight training unit’s maintenance control system no longer meets the requirements of these Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: insert amendments to its maintenance control manual into each copy of the manual within 30 days after approval of the amendments pursuant to paragraph (d).

Subsection.Text: The Minister may authorize the incorporation by reference in a maintenance control manual of detailed procedures manuals prepared by the flight training unit, where

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the policies affecting the detailed procedures remain in the maintenance control manual;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the incorporation is clearly indicated in the maintenance control manual;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the flight training unit ensures that the incorporated manuals meet the requirements of this section; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the person responsible for the flight training unit’s maintenance control system, or the person to whom this function has been assigned pursuant to subsection 406.36(3), has certified in writing that the incorporated manuals meet the requirements of this section.

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall approve a maintenance control manual and any amendments to the manual, where the personnel licensing standards are met.

No flight training unit that operates an aeroplane or a helicopter shall permit a person or organization to perform maintenance on the flight training unit’s aircraft unless the person or organization has adequate facilities, equipment, spare parts and personnel available at the site where the maintenance is to be performed and

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person or organization holds an approved maintenance organization (AMO) certificate issued pursuant to section 573.02 that is rated in the category for the maintenance to be performed;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: where the maintenance is to be performed outside Canada by a person or organization that does not hold an approved maintenance organization (AMO) certificate issued pursuant to section 573.02, the person or organization has been approved under the laws of a state that is party to an agreement with Canada that provides for recognition of the work performed; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
