Subsection.Text: No air traffic controller shall issue an air traffic control clearance or an air traffic control instruction except

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of domestic airspace, in accordance with the Canadian Domestic Air Traffic Control Separation Standards; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of international airspace in respect of which Canada has accepted, by means of a regional air navigation agreement, the responsibility of providing air navigation services, in accordance with the standards contained in Chapter 3 of Annex 11 to the Convention.

Heading.TitleText: Services to Be Provided in Class A, B, C, D and E Airspace

Subsection.Text: Where air traffic control services are provided to aircraft operating in Class A or Class B airspace, the services shall include separation between aircraft.
Where air traffic control services are provided to aircraft operating in Class C airspace, the services shall include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: conflict resolution between IFR aircraft and VFR aircraft;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: conflict resolution between VFR aircraft on request;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: traffic information; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: separation between IFR aircraft and between all aircraft during runway operations.

Subsection.Text: Where air traffic control services are provided to aircraft operating in Class D airspace, the services shall include

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: traffic information; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: separation between IFR aircraft, and between all aircraft during runway operations.

Subsection.Text: Where air traffic control services are provided to aircraft operating in Class E airspace, the services shall include separation between IFR aircraft.

Section.Text: No person shall operate an air traffic control unit or a flight service station unless the person holds and complies with the provisions of an ATS operations certificate that authorizes the person to operate the air traffic control unit or flight service station.
An applicant for an ATS operations certificate shall submit to the Minister

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an application for an ATS operations certificate; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of the proposed ATS site manual for each operational location to be listed on the certificate.

Subsection.Text: Subject to section 6.71 of the Act, the Minister shall issue an ATS operations certificate to an applicant, authorizing the applicant to operate an air traffic control unit or a flight service station, if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant demonstrates that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: it has personnel who are qualified to provide an air traffic service at the operational location of the air traffic control unit or flight service station, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the air traffic control unit or flight service station will be operated in a manner that provides for safe aircraft operations; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an ATS site manual for the operational location has been approved by the Minister.

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall approve an ATS site manual if it

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: accurately describes the operational location of the air traffic control unit or flight service station; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: contains the information required pursuant to section 801.07.

Section.Text: An ATS operations certificate shall contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the legal name, trade name and address of the holder of the certificate;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the number of the certificate;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the date of issue of the certificate;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the effective date of certification;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the types of air traffic services that the holder of the certificate is authorized to provide; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a list of the operational locations for which an ATS site manual has been approved by the Minister.

Subsection.Text: An ATS site manual shall set out the types of air traffic services that are provided by the holder of the ATS operations certificate at that operational location.
An ATS site manual shall contain

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a table of contents;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: any information relating to the administration of the air traffic control unit or flight service station, including

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a record of any amendments to the manual,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a list of the holders of copies of the manual,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a description of the procedure for amending the manual,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a description of the organizational structure of the air traffic control unit management or the flight service station management,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: a statement, signed by the holder of the ATS operations certificate, certifying that the manual is complete and accurate, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: a statement, signed by the Minister, indicating that the Minister has approved the manual;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: any information relating to the operation of the air traffic control unit or flight service station, including

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a description of the airspace and its classification,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: where applicable, a description of the manoeuvring area and the movement area of the airport, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: a description of a system to ensure that any operational information necessary for operational staff to perform their duties or functions is available on a daily basis;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in the case where air traffic advisory services or flight information services are provided, a description of the procedures for providing those services;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the procedures for providing emergency assistance services;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a copy of any agreements or memoranda of understanding relating to the operation of the air traffic control unit or flight service station; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of an air traffic control unit or flight service station that is located at an airport, all information pertaining to the airport in respect of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: emergency response measures,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: airport safety measures,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: access to the movement area and vehicle control procedures,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: apron management plans and apron safety plans, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: information services in respect of runway surface friction characteristics.

Heading.TitleText: Provision of Air Traffic Services in accordance with ATS Site Manual

Section.Text: No holder of an ATS operations certificate shall provide air traffic services at an operational location unless the services are provided in accordance with

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the ATS site manual; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of air traffic control services, the Canadian Domestic Air Traffic Control Separation Standards.

Heading.TitleText: Training and Competency of Flight Service Specialists

Subsection.Text: No holder of an ATS operations certificate who operates a flight service station shall permit a person to act, and no person shall act, as a flight service specialist unless the person

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: has successfully completed

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: training that has been accepted by the Minister in the performance of the functions of a flight service specialist, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: a safety-related initial training course on human and organizational factors; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has been certified by the holder of the certificate as being competent to perform those functions.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of a person who, under supervision, acts as a flight service specialist while undergoing

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: instruction, training or testing in respect of flight service specialist certification; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: flight service station familiarization in the course of the person’s employment.

Subsection.Text: The holder of an ATS operations certificate who operates a flight service station shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: maintain, for each person who acts as a flight service specialist, a training record showing the place where and the date on which the person successfully completed the training referred to in paragraph (1)(a); and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: at the request of the Minister, provide the Minister with a copy of the training record of any person acting as a flight service specialist at that flight service station.

Heading.TitleText: Provision of Air Traffic Services in Accordance with the ESCAT Plan

Section.Text: If the holder of an ATS operations certificate is notified by the Minister of National Defence of the implementation of the ESCAT plan, the certificate holder shall ensure that air traffic services are provided to aircraft in accordance with the contents of the plan.
In this Subpart, aeronautical telecommunications system includes radio navigation aids and aeronautical communications systems.

Subsection.Text: A person who operates any equipment that is part of an aeronautical telecommunications system referred to in Annex 10 to the Convention shall ensure that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the equipment is installed, maintained and operated in accordance with the standards specified in Annex 10 to the Convention; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: documentation is maintained that shows how compliance with the standards referred to in paragraph (a) is being achieved.

Subsection.Text: No person shall perform a function related to the installation, maintenance or operation of any aeronautical telecommunications equipment unless the person has successfully completed training in the performance of that function and has been certified by the operator of the aeronautical telecommunications system as being competent to perform that function.
A person who operates any ground equipment in support of satellite navigation systems shall ensure that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the equipment is installed, maintained and operated in accordance with the standards specified in the manual entitled GNSS IFR Operations; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: documentation is maintained that shows how compliance with the standards referred to in paragraph (a) is being achieved.

Subsection.Text: A person who operates any equipment that is part of an aeronautical telecommunications system referred to in subsection (1) or (3) shall, at the request of the Minister, provide the Minister with a copy of the documentation referred to in paragraph (1)(b) or (3)(b).
In this Subpart, aeronautical information services means the services necessary to meet the requirements of Annexes 4 and 15 to the Convention that relate to aeronautical information.
No person shall provide aeronautical information services except in accordance with the standards set out in Annexes 4 and 15 to the Convention.

Heading.TitleText: Development and Publication of Instrument Procedures

Section.Text: No person shall publish or submit for publishing in the Canada Air Pilot an instrument procedure unless the procedure has been developed

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in accordance with the standards and criteria specified in the manual entitled Criteria for the Development of Instrument Procedures; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: by a person who has successfully completed training in the interpretation and application of the standards and criteria specified in the manual entitled Criteria for the Development of Instrument Procedures, which training has been accepted by the Minister.

Heading.TitleText: Subpart 4 — Aviation Weather Services and Assessment of Runway Visibility

Subsection.Text: Subject to Division III, a person who provides aviation weather services shall provide them in accordance with the standards specified in

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: Annex 3 to the Convention;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the Manual of Standards and Procedures for Aviation Weather Forecasts; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the Manual of Surface Weather Observations.

Subsection.Text: For the purpose of paragraph (1)(a), the words aerodrome and aircraft used in Annex 3 to the Convention have the same meaning as in subsection 3(1) of the Act.
For the purpose of paragraph (1)(a), the expressions alternate aerodrome, control area and flight crew member used in Annex 3 to the Convention have the same meaning as in subsection 101.01(1).

For the purpose of paragraph (1)(a), the expressions operator, runway visual range (RVR) and visibility used in Annex 3 to the Convention have the same meaning as air operator, RVR or runway visual range and runway visibility, respectively, in subsection 101.01(1).

Heading.Code: ga="s_800.01",gb="s_804.01",gc="h_Division II — Meteorological Observations Measured By Automatic Instrumentation Of Wind, Temperature, Humidity Or Atmospheric Pressure",h1=""

TitleText.Code: ga="s_800.01",gb="s_804.01",gc="h_Division II — Meteorological Observations Measured By Automatic Instrumentation Of Wind, Temperature, Humidity Or Atmospheric Pressure",h1="",t1="",nb="1"

Heading.TitleText: Division II — Meteorological Observations Measured By Automatic Instrumentation Of Wind, Temperature, Humidity Or Atmospheric Pressure

Reserved.Code: ga="s_800.01",gb="s_804.01",gc="h_Division II — Meteorological Observations Measured By Automatic Instrumentation Of Wind, Temperature, Humidity Or Atmospheric Pressure",rv="",nb="156"

Section.Text: This Division applies to a person, other than a pilot who meets the requirements of section 602.131, who makes or reports an assessment of runway visibility at an aerodrome with the permission of the operator of the aerodrome.

Heading.TitleText: Visibility Markers and Visibility Markers Charts

Subsection.Text: The operator of an aerodrome shall establish visibility markers that meet the requirements of section 824.23 of Standard 824 — Runway Visibility Assessment Standards.
The operator of an aerodrome shall produce a visibility markers chart that meets the requirements of section 824.23 of Standard 824 — Runway Visibility Assessment Standards.

Heading.TitleText: Person Qualified to Assess and Report Runway Visibility

Section.Text: Except for a pilot who meets the requirements of section 602.131, no person other than a person qualified in accordance with section 804.26 shall assess runway visibility and report the assessment.

Heading.TitleText: Assessment and Reporting of Runway Visibility

Subsection.Text: A person qualified to assess runway visibility shall obtain authorization to report an assessment of runway visibility from the operator of the aerodrome.
A person qualified to assess runway visibility shall assess runway visibility and report the assessment in accordance with section 824.25 of Standard 824 — Runway Visibility Assessment Standards.

Section.Text: A person who assesses runway visibility shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: have a distant visual acuity with or without correction of 6/12 (20/40) or better in each eye separately and binocular visual acuity of 6/9 (20/30) or better;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: be qualified to operate a vehicle equipped with a two-way radio communication system on the manoeuvring area of the aerodrome; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: have received the training set out in section 824.26 of Standard 824 — Runway Visibility Assessment Standards.

Section.Text: The safety management system required under section 107.02 in respect of an applicant for, or a holder of, an ATS operations certificate shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: meet the requirements of Subpart 7 of Part I and section 805.02; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: be under the control of the accountable executive appointed under paragraph 106.02(1)(a).

Heading.TitleText: Components of the Safety Management System

Subsection.Text: The safety management system shall include, among others, the following components:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a safety management plan that includes

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: a safety policy that the accountable executive has approved and communicated to all employees,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the roles and responsibilities of personnel assigned duties under the safety management system,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: performance goals and a means of measuring attainment of those goals,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a policy for the internal reporting of hazards, incidents and accidents, including the conditions under which immunity from disciplinary action will be granted, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: a process for reviewing the safety management system to determine its effectiveness;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: procedures for reporting hazards, incidents and accidents to the appropriate manager;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: procedures for the collection of data relating to hazards, incidents and accidents;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: procedures for the exchange of information in respect of hazards, incidents and accidents among the operators of aircraft and the provider of air traffic services at an airport and the airport operator;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: procedures for analysing data obtained under paragraph (c) and during an audit conducted under subsection 805.03(3) and for taking corrective actions;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: training requirements for the accountable executive and for personnel assigned duties under the safety management system;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: procedures for making progress reports to the accountable executive at intervals determined by the accountable executive and other reports as needed in urgent cases; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: procedures for involving employees in the implementation and ongoing development of the safety management system.

Subsection.Text: The components specified in subsection (1) shall be set out in a manual or another document established by the holder of the ATS operations certificate that includes

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a record of any amendments to the manual or document;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the procedures for amending the manual or document; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a statement, signed by the accountable executive, certifying that the manual or document is complete and its content accurate.

Subsection.Text: The Minister shall approve the manual or document if it contains the information and statement required under subsection (2).

The quality assurance program required under paragraph 107.03(g) in respect of an applicant for, or a holder of, an ATS operations certificate shall include a process for quality assurance that includes periodic reviews or audits of the activities authorized under a certificate and reviews or audits, for cause, of those activities.

The holder of an ATS operations certificate shall ensure that records relating to the findings resulting from the quality assurance program are distributed to the appropriate manager for corrective action and follow-up in accordance with the policies and procedures specified in the manual or document established under subsection 805.02(2).
The holder of an ATS operations certificate shall establish an audit system in respect of the quality assurance program that consists of the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: an initial audit conducted within 12 months after the day on which the ATS operations certificate is issued;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: an audit of the entire quality assurance program carried out every three years, calculated

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of an ATS operations certificate issued before January 1, 2008, from that date, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: in the case of an ATS operations certificate issued on or after January 1, 2008, from the date of the initial audit;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: checklists of all activities carried out under the certificate;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a record of each occurrence of compliance or non-compliance with the checklists in respect of the activities carried out under the certificate that is found during an audit referred to in paragraph (a) or (b);

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: procedures for ensuring that each finding of an audit is communicated to the accountable executive;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: follow-up procedures for ensuring that corrective actions are effective; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a system for recording the findings of an audit referred to in paragraph (a) or (b), corrective actions and follow-ups.

Subsection.Text: The audit referred to in paragraph (3)(b) shall be carried out in one of the following ways:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: as a complete audit, or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: as a series of audits conducted at intervals determined by the holder of the ATS operations certificate and set out in the manual or document established under subsection 805.02(2).

Subsection.Text: The records resulting from a system required under paragraph (3)(g) shall be retained for the greater of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: two audit cycles, and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: two years.

Subsection.Text: The duties related to the quality assurance program that involve specific tasks or activities among the activities of an ATS operations certificate holder shall be fulfilled by persons who are not responsible for carrying out those tasks or activities unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the size, nature and complexity of the operations and activities authorized under the ATS operations certificate justify the fulfilling of those duties by the person responsible for carrying out those tasks or activities;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the holder of the ATS operations certificate demonstrates to the Minister by means of a risk analysis, that the fulfilling of those duties by the person responsible for carrying out those tasks or activities will not result in an unacceptable risk to aviation safety; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the holder of the ATS operations certificate provides the Minister, in writing, with the information required under paragraphs (a) and (b).

Section.Text: The holder of an ATS operations certificate shall ensure that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: corrective actions are taken in respect of any findings resulting from the safety management system referred to in section 805.01; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the accountable executive performs the duties prescribed in section 805.05.

Heading.TitleText: Management of the Safety Management System

Subsection.Text: The accountable executive shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: establish and maintain a reporting system to ensure the timely collection of information related to hazards, incidents and accidents that may adversely affect safety;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: identify hazards and carry out risk management analyses of those hazards;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: investigate, analyze and identify the cause or probable cause of all hazards, incidents and accidents identified under the safety management system;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: establish and maintain a safety data system, by either electronic or other means, to monitor and analyze trends in hazards, incidents and accidents;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: monitor and evaluate the results of corrective actions with respect to hazards, incidents and accidents;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: monitor the concerns of the civil aviation industry in respect of safety and their perceived effect on the holder of the ATS operations certificate; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: determine the adequacy of the training required by paragraph 805.02(1)(f).

Subsection.Text: The accountable executive shall, if a finding resulting from a quality assurance program referred to in subsection 805.03(1) or a safety management system referred to in section 805.01 is reported to them,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: determine what, if any, corrective actions are required and carry out those actions;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: keep a record of any determination made under paragraph (a) and the reason for it;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if management functions have been assigned to another person under subsection (3), communicate any determination regarding a corrective action to that person; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: notify the certificate holder of any systemic deficiency and of the corrective action taken.

Subsection.Text: The accountable executive may assign the management functions of the safety management system referred to in section 805.01 to another person if the assignment and its scope are described in the manual or document referred to in subsection 805.02(2).
The person to whom management functions have been assigned under subsection (3) shall notify the accountable executive of any systemic deficiency and of the corrective action taken.
The responsibility of the accountable executive is not affected by the assignment of management functions to another person under subsection (3).

Section.Text: In this Subpart,

Definition.Text: aeronautical study means a study designed to identify the risks to aviation safety attendant upon a particular course of action and how to eliminate or reduce those risks; (étude aéronautique)

level of service means the type or nature of civil air navigation services provided to support safe and efficient aircraft operations, and includes the times at which the services are provided. (niveau de service)

Subsection.Text: Every person who provides a civil air navigation service shall, where the person proposes to terminate the service or to reduce the level of service that is provided, notify the Minister

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in the case of a proposal to terminate the service or to materially reduce the level of service, at least 60 days before the termination or reduction; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in all other cases, as far in advance of the reduction as reasonably practicable.

Subsection.Text: On receipt of a notice referred to in subsection (1) from the ANS Corporation, the Minister may request the ANS Corporation to conduct an aeronautical study for the purpose of demonstrating that the risk to aviation safety would not be unacceptably increased by the proposed termination or reduction in the level of service.

Where the Minister requests the ANS Corporation to conduct an aeronautical study pursuant to subsection (2), the ANS Corporation shall not implement the proposed termination or reduction in the level of service until the Minister has been provided with a copy of the study and has had a reasonable opportunity to review it.

Where, after reviewing an aeronautical study conducted pursuant to subsection (2), the Minister is of the opinion that an unacceptable risk to aviation safety would result from the proposed termination or reduction in the level of service, the Minister may, by order, direct the ANS Corporation to maintain its level of service in accordance with the terms and conditions specified in the order.

Section.Text: Where, after conducting an aeronautical study or reviewing an aeronautical study conducted by another person or organization, the Minister is of the opinion that the level of service provided by the ANS Corporation should be increased in the interests of aviation safety, the Minister may, by order, direct the ANS Corporation to increase its level of service in accordance with the terms and conditions specified in the order.

The holder of an ATS operations certificate shall report to the Minister any aviation occurrence information specified in the CADORS Manual in accordance with the criteria and reporting procedures specified in that manual.
